title: 去紫竹公园啦
content: 春意很浓, 公园果然有山有水, 各式各样的人, 各式各样的活动.我在公园背单词, 效果一般哈哈啊哈. 今天洗了一顿衣服. 背了200, 复习了400天啊, 未来可能一天要复习800. 太恐怖了. 晚上回来学了一顿redis, 安装那里稍微慢了一丢丢, 其他地方进度正常. 回去背点单词, 有时间就学系统结构. 明天 上午弄英语, 上午就弄完. 下午出去玩, 还没想好去哪. 先写OS吧, 照着抄好了. 估计主要是写测试. 晚上还学redis. 晚上复习英语. 琐事: 耳机充电, 手机充电, 把充电器拿到教三啊啊啊. 去图书馆找一下水壶谢谢… 感觉学校的课学得有点儿少哈哈哈, 不知道

title: Redis
content: 入门概述Redis: Remote Dictionary Server(远程字典服务器)基于内存的, 用C语言写的, 数据库. Redis之父, 安特雷兹. 如果Redis挂了, 大量的访问又打到MySQL了, 所以要设置集群, 一个挂了另一个顶上. 讲了Redis7新特性: 说Redis function不学, 还是用lua脚本 listpack代替zlist 多个aof 性能提升 安装redis, 刚开始装在Linux课给的公共服务器上发现不行, 没权限.于是装在虚拟机上了. 更改redis.conf老师有个好习惯, 他把官网的配置文件备份了一份, 不直接在原文件上修改 redis.conf配置文件，改完后确保生效，记得重启，记得重启 1 默认daemonize no 改为 daemonize yes 后台启动:是 2 默认protected-mode yes 改为 protected-mode no 保护模式关闭, 可以远程访问. 3 默认bind 127.0.0.1 改为 直接注释掉(默认bind 127.0.0.1只能本机访问)或改成本机IP地址，否则影响远程IP连接 4 添加redis密码 改为 requirepass 你自己设置的密码 我的密码是: zizhugongyuan 紫竹公园 redis: 退出是quit关闭服务是: SHUTDOWN 也可以远程关闭 redis-cli -a 你的密码 shutdown 介绍了10大数据类型是那些: string set zset list map 地理空间GEO bitmap bitfield HyperLogLog 基数统计 redis流:stream – (消息中间件) 2024-4-4 今天看了: 8 ~ 13 13/178了哈哈哈, 加油, 别看多, 真的能完成. 今天基本上2h多一点点. string 讲了一些基础命令 set 参数 ex:设置过期时间 xx: 存在则创建 nx: 不存在则创建get: 先get到老值, 再set新值 keepttl: 把原有的过期时间保留着.mset, mgetsetnx, setex 这两个是分布式锁那里要用.其实笔记上和官网都有. 讲了list, 就是队列的应用场景, 微信公众号我关注了100个博主, 我的页面总有一个最近更新队列, 就可以用list实现. 讲了hashmap, 应用场景是购物车(简单的实现), 确实能对应上, 相当于是表中有表, 每个用户对应一个hashmap, 每个hashmap的key是商品, value是商品数量, 因为redis的key-value可以是任意数据类型, 所以还可以保存用户id等等 list有序, 有重复. set无序无重复. set应用场景:微信抽奖小程序展现点赞列表统计可能认识的人 zset 的 score 可以是小数, 但是会丢失精度 bitmap hyperloglog 用于统计 uv = unique visitor 只能返回有多少个不同的元素, 而不能保存每个元素具体是什么. 有0.81%误差 是string类型 GEO 是 zset类型 , 用于附近的人, 滴滴, 等移动互联网场景. redis - stream就是redis版本的MQ 消息中间件大概有个印象, 最后还是用kafuka(也不见得) bitfield 能修改每一位, 案例演示了吧hello –> hxllo的过程, 通过二进制更改0和1实现. 2024-4-6 今天看到了27, 十大数据类型看完了, 除了5个基础的, bitmap, GEO, hyperloglog, 这三个还有点儿用, stream和bitfield先不做重点.

title: 试图回到全力模式的第一天
path: /2024/04/02/[日记]试图回到全力模式的第一天/
content: 篮球打得很憋屈对面很强, 我们没篮板, 对面姿势很怪异, 但是能进, 有一个博士很全能, 没得打…我们这边其实还是一样, 我摘了眼镜, 不准, 负面情绪很重. 不是一个好的球手.今晚看到有女生晚上去球场, 不知道能不能回头去碰碰运气. GRE仍然客观的在那里我觉得我目前阶段好好背单词的收益最大. 想做题, 想练一练, 感觉就是6选2和阅读可能能练, 其他的长句子里面一旦有生词, 我就很难受, 这个问题咋克服, 得想. 心情不好的时候就会放纵一天没看抖音, 打完篮球回去吃饭看了2小时抖音. 现在8点半了. 今天学一下计算机系统结构, 十点半回宿舍洗个澡吧. 明天安排上午有软件工程, 早起来教三, 背单词, 软件工程课去上, 课上听课学软工的东西.下午没课, 天气好骑车, 学计算机系统结构, 我这一周都学计算机系统结构.晚上复习单词, 学计算机系统结构, 做做牛客论坛项目.

title: aaa
content: 小小失败,能奈我何每天大概花1h背单词, 剩下的时间花在课内的课程上, 先看看有没有余下的精力干别的再说. 该换眼镜了, 回宿舍找一找眼镜. 把课程的东西捋一捋, 然后再说. 我有几门课?必修: 软工 (考试) 现代交换 (考试) 系统结构 (考试) 指定选修: Linux (考试) 移动应用 下一代internet 大数据 智慧树:有四门 实验: OS实验 专业实习: 还有5次 给自己个小目标吧 每天不看不听色情的东西就 +5 2天之后不手冲就算 +10 每天完成背单词任务就 +20 每天看抖音小于2h 就 +20 每天12:00 前睡 +5 金铲铲数量<=2 就+10 如果只打了1把 +20 每天写日记, 知道明天做啥 +10 明天 起床吃饭, 来教三背单词, 还有时间看移动应用开发 上完体育课吃饭, 回寝室睡觉, 洗个衣服 下午学系统结构, 把已经讲过的学会这总不应该出错 如果不刮风就骑车去个公园. 晚上学一学现代交换 把一些基础概念弄懂 最后可以复习一波单词, 做一波填空 关于填空我觉得可以做在本子上, 不用再写总结了, 这样可以快一些, 单词可以查 如果真的闲可以先加大GRE的训练量, 闷声发大财也不是不行再无聊可以问问顾 或者 徐

title: 低谷中的小欢欣
content: 难得静下来写两句话GRE: 142 + 169 + 3.0 这还是准备了2个月的结果. 算是低谷的一个小开始.删了小刘, 发了发牢骚的说说, 被骂, 至今没想明白, 也不再去想.NGNE之前还抱有幻想, 现在看来, 希望渺茫.上周六面试了一个北邮老师课内的项目, 问了java包管理工具是啥, 没说上来. 我不知道maven就叫java包管理工具啊. 其实要是这么看, 现在的状态挺难受的. 但是闫爹劝我, 他说你做什么事情都比较着急, 着急就会显得刻意. 我现在理解, 着急, 可能是说的是注重结果, 一开始就想要最终的结果, 确实, 反而真正要取得结果没有一段时间的过程是不太行的. 我发现人最舒服的状态是为一个看得见的东西去一点点付出的过程. 这个过程中的这个状态是最舒服的. 我今天就算是挺开心的, 因为我早上七点半基本上就自然醒了, 然后想着这么早, 干脆去教三吧, 这是我第一次在体育课之前干事情, 很顺利就把计算机系统结构的两道作业题做了. 中午吃完饭没回寝室, 去教三虽然困, 但是跟着教程学Linux正则表达式, 感觉挺好的, 虽然还是着急, 但是基本上顺顺利利做完了. 做完了休息了一小会儿, 又纯靠GPT写了调研国产CPU的报告, 这种东西不那么用心我觉得是OK的, 虽然估计邝坚院长可能会看, 但是我就是不想让这种我不知道去哪里寻找信息, 又短期内对我帮助不大的事情太影响我. 然后就是打飞机(我最近性瘾好重), 打球, 吃饭, 回宿舍玩, 洗澡, 洗澡回来换衣服收拾, 写日记, 现在快9点了, 开始学学牛客论坛, 学学技术提升自己, 不用太着急的.

title: [日记]感兴趣的教授和研究方向
path: /2024/03/12/日记-感兴趣的教授和研究方向/
content: 邱小正: 代码分析, 静态和动态程序分析. Jin Chen Information Structure Design and Social Learning when Facing Information Manipulation Addressing the surge in fake information dissemination on e-commerce and social media platforms, the project aims to explore optimal information structures to combat issues such as fake orders, reviews, and misinformation. GOH Khim Yong Social-Mobile and E-Commerce Live Streaming Videos and Socio-Economic ImpactsLive streaming is booming across social media and e-commerce platforms. However, the dynamics of broadcaster-audience interactions and their impact on engagement and purchasing are largely unexplored. This project seeks to address this gap by examining the elements in live streaming that stimulate social presence and emotional arousal, and influence viewer engagement and consumer purchases. Economics of AI Pricing on E-Commerce PlatformsThe use of artificial intelligence (AI) pricing agents has become prevalent, with many digital platforms including e-commerce platforms (ECPs), introducing AI pricing agents to provide sellers with AI-generated price recommendations. This project aims to apply relevant theoretical perspectives to examine factors that influence AI recommendation adoption, and the impact of such adoption on ECPs. OH Lih Bin研究方向: Digital Transformation, Platforms & Innovation项目: Enhancing Adult Learning Using A Mobile Micro-Learning Platform With Integrated Nudging Interventions: A Design-Based Research Approach Adult learning research often overlooks the diversity of learners and conflates perception with reality. This project tackles this by: creating distinct adult learner archetypes, 2) developing a mobile micro-learning platform (informed by cognitive load and nudging theories) tailored to these archetypes, and 3) investigating its impact on learning outcomes. TAN Chuan HooDigitalization with special interests in healthcare institutions, corporations, and ephemeral organization (e.g., disaster response) Digital economy with special interests in digital shopping and gig economy Digitalization for Disaster Response Mission The climate crisis lurks in the background and steadily instills disasters, such as earthquakes, tsunamis, volcanic eruptions, floods, landslides, and cyclones. This research project examines how technology can be designed and implemented to support activated disaster response organizations in their operations. TAN Wee Kek 陈伟克His current primary research interests focus on consumer-based information technology (e.g., online decision aids, social computing, virtual worlds and consumer cloud services). Most of his research is based on design science, a well-established problem-solving paradigm that has been widely adopted in information systems research. His current secondary research interests focus on information systems education. His current teaching interests include imparting senior undergraduate students with knowledge and skills to develop enterprise information systems as well as teaching them principles of information security management, and concepts of mobile and ubiquitous commerce. 陈敏之 Sharon TANEnhancing Student Engagement in Online Learning: A Design Science Approach Online learning gained traction during the pandemic and is expected to stay for its resilience in crisis. While blended learning is promising, student engagement remains a challenge. This project targets the issue by developing a comprehensive engagement measure, an interactive dashboard for data visualization, and diverse instructor interventions to improve student engagement in blended learning. Use and Implementation of IT/Analytics on Health Behaviour Modification and Education 乔丹丹北邮人! 黄克伟黄博士的研究兴趣是信息系统经济学和金融应用数据挖掘。目前，他专注于数字产品定价、IT 专业人员的劳动经济学以及会计或金融主题的数据挖掘或计量经济学问题等各种主题 我思考一下, 目前感觉是: 特别牛逼的教授不要写了, 他们大概率没时间指导我CP3106, 我更需要一个有时间指导我的. 另外就是,暂定,IS放前面. 第一个位置很重要. 关于要不要找讲师指导我, 也是再考虑一下, 关键是讲师的主页没有什么方向介绍. 郑佳祺哥说, 匹配度和兴趣比较关键. Michael David ADAMS – 啥也没写.Assistant ProfessorCOM3-02-47 660 17690 CHIN Wei Ngan – noAssociate ProfessorCOM3-02-11 651 66228 DONG Jin Song – 顶级大佬, 我可能接不住ProfessorDeputy Head, Department Of Computer ScienceCOM2-03-19 651 64353 Martin HENZ – 有点儿看不懂, 但是对他印象不错Associate ProfessorCOM3-02-05 651 66632 Joxan JAFFAR – 这个是大哥, 他研究的我看不懂ProfessorCOM1-03-11 651 67846 KHOO Siau ChengAssociate ProfessorCOM2-04-11 651 66730 Umang MATHUR – 年轻牛逼, 而且他说缺人, 应该能算牛导NUS Presidential Young ProfessorCOM3-02-53 651 65219 Kuldeep S. MEEL – 搞理论的数学家, 跟我不沾边Associate ProfessorCOM2-03-41 651 61422 Akshay NARAYAN – 他偏人工智能的, 我基本是一点不懂, 虽然也讲面向对象编程.Lecturer (Educator Track)COM2-02-03651 64779 Ganesh NEELAKANTA IYER – 挺厉害, 挺喜欢, 挺符合, 估计选的人多, 我打算把他放上但是不放最前面.Lecturer (Educator Track)COM2-03-55 660 17601 Damith Chatura RAJAPAKSE – 很对, 很强, 重点看这个人.Associate Professor (Educator Track)Deputy Head, Department Of Computer ScienceCOM2-02-57 651 64359 Manuel RIGGER – 介绍太少又看不懂, 再找找别人吧Assistant ProfessorCOM2-03-29 660 17691 Abhik ROYCHOUDHURY – 这应该是大哥, 搞软件测试的, 自动修复这种我确实听不懂的东西.Provost’s Chair ProfessorCOM3-02-04 651 68939 Ilya SERGEY – 更牛逼一些的软工, 分布式系统, 并发, 设计编程语言, 放上但是不排到前面.Associate ProfessorCOM3-02-56 660 11466 Bimlesh WADHWA – 软工相关, 把她的优先级调高Associate Professor (Educator Track)Assistant Dean, Student LifeCOM2-02-62 651 62973 Roland YAP 研究方向太多, 看来是个大佬, 先不考虑Associate ProfessorCOM2-03-09 651 62972

title: 又提笔写流水账
content: 当前的情势我最想实现的, 是NGNE的申请, 遇到的问题: cv和ps还没有准备到完美, 打算拿出1周时间, 每天认真想一想, 暂定本周日17号交. 各种教授的信息url点击不成功, 填写申请表目前卡在一个位置. 一个人战斗信息不太透明, 感觉可以不耻下问一下. 然后是学好学校的课, 原因有3: 保研可以用 出国也看gpa 学校的课比较硬核, 可以好好学一学, 加深一下对计算机的理解. 然后才是项目和八股文和算法题: 争取10天把论坛项目做完 然后八股文把网络和java基础先搞清楚, Redis看着. 觉得准备差不多了再开始投, 没结果也没关系. 最后是GRE, 虽然现在知道怎么做, 但是按照优先级来说, 这个先不急, 在ngne项目之后, 再开始无妨. 人都会遇到点儿困难, 不能因为这点儿困难就给自己太大压力.

title: 假如期末考Redis
content: 参考博客1: http://t.csdnimg.cn/1DvHc 什么是Redis?Redis，英文全称是Remote Dictionary Server（远程字典服务），是一个开源的使用ANSI C语言编写、支持网络、可基于内存亦可持久化的日志型、Key-Value数据库，并提供多种语言的API。 与MySQL数据库不同的是，Redis的数据是存在内存中的。它的读写速度非常快，每秒可以处理超过10万次读写操作。因此redis被广泛应用于缓存，另外，Redis也经常用来做分布式锁。除此之外，Redis支持事务、持久化、LUA 脚本、LRU 驱动事件、多种集群方案。 Redis数据结构类型?基本类型: String List Hash Set sorted set(有序集合) 特殊类型: Geospatial Hyperloglog Bitmap Redis 5 种基本数据类型?String 简介:String是Redis最基础的数据结构类型，它是二进制安全的，可以存储图片或者序列化的对象，值最大存储为512M 简单使用举例: set key value、get key等 应用场景：共享session、分布式锁，计数器、限流。 内部编码有3种，int（8字节长整型）/embstr（小于等于39字节字符串）/raw（大于39个字节字符串） C语言的字符串是char[]实现的，而Redis使用SDS（simple dynamic string） 封装，sds源码如下： 12345struct sdshdr{ unsigned int len;//标记buffer长度 unsigned int free;//标记空闲buffer中未使用的元素个数 char buffer [];} 啥叫二进制安全?C语言中的字符串是根据特殊字符“\0”来判断该字符串是否结束，对于字符串str=01234567890123456789”来说，在C语言里面str的长度就是10,strlen(str)=10，所以strlen()函数不是二进制安全的。而在Redis中，strlen str的结果是21，是二进制安全的（Redis底层所使用的字符串表示是Sds），它只关心二进制化的字符串，不关心字符串的具体格式，里面有啥字符，只会严格的按照二进制的数据存取，不会以某种特殊格式解析字符串. %}Redis使用SDS结构, 而不是使用C语言的一个char buf[], 有什么好处.字符串长度处理：Redis获取字符串长度，时间复杂度为O(1)，而C语言中，需要从头开始遍历，复杂度为O（n）;空间预分配：字符串修改越频繁的话，内存分配越频繁，就会消耗性能，而SDS修改和空间扩充，会额外分配未使用的空间，减少性能损耗。惰性空间释放：SDS 缩短时，不是回收多余的内存空间，而是free记录下多余的空间，后续有变更，直接使用free中记录的空间，减少分配。二进制安全：Redis可以存储一些二进制数据，在C语言中字符串遇到’0’会结束，而 SDS中标志字符串结束的是len属性。

title: javamail发送邮件
content: 参考博客: http://t.csdnimg.cn/h20nT 用spring boot 整合了的 javamail 发送邮件步骤. 首先邮箱要开启smpt服务, 而且会获得一个授权码, 授权码用于第三方登录邮箱. 第二步配置application.properties: 1234567# MailPropertiesspring.mail.host=smtp.qq.comspring.mail.post=465spring.mail.username=656501226@qq.comspring.mail.password=vlhrbb*****spring.mail.protocol=smtpsspring.mail.properties.mail.smtp.ssl.enable=true 注意点是, password这里填写的是授权码, 不是自己的邮箱密码. 第三步编写utils包下的工具类MailClient, 写一个发送邮件的方法. 1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526@Componentpublic class MailClient { private static final Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger(MailClient.class); @Autowired private JavaMailSender mailSender; @Value("${spring.mail.username}") private String from; public void sendMail(String to, String subject, String content){ MimeMessage message = mailSender.createMimeMessage(); MimeMessageHelper helper = new MimeMessageHelper(message); //logger.info("hahaha"); try { helper.setFrom(from); helper.setTo(to); helper.setSubject(subject); helper.setText(content, true); mailSender.send(helper.getMimeMessage()); } catch (MessagingException e) { logger.error("email send fail" + e.getMessage()); } //logger.info("heiheihei"); }} 关于spring中注解@Value的用法, 参考博客: http://t.csdnimg.cn/Q4KTW 在使用spring框架的项目中，@Value是经常使用的注解之一。其功能是将与配置文件中的键对应的值分配给其带注解的属性。在日常使用中，我们常用的功能相对简单。本文使您系统地了解@Value的用法。 @Value 注解可以用来将外部的值动态注入到 Bean 中，在 @Value 注解中，可以使${} 与 #{} ，它们的区别如下： （1）@Value(“${}”)：可以获取对应属性文件中定义的属性值。 （2）@Value(“#{}”)：表示 SpEl 表达式通常用来获取 bean 的属性，或者调用 bean 的某个方法。 最后一步在测试类中编写测试方法, 发现可以发送邮件. 我遇到一个小bug是我粗心地忘记了写 mailSender.send(), 导致邮件只是不停的被编辑而没有被发送. 1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526@RunWith(SpringRunner.class)@SpringBootTest@ContextConfiguration(classes = CommunityApplication.class)public class MailTests { @Autowired private MailClient mailClient; @Autowired private TemplateEngine templateEngine; @Test public void testSendMail(){ mailClient.sendMail("1187779774@qq.com","aidushu","kenchiku"); } @Test public void testHtmlMail(){ Context context = new Context(); context.setVariable("username","kenchiku"); String content = templateEngine.process("/mail/demo",context); mailClient.sendMail("yang_zhicheng@bupt.edu.cn","html",content); }}

title: GRE阅读05
content: 单题XGPR001Eighty percent of the writers in the National Press Association attended college, as opposed to only sixty percent of the newscasters in the association.One can conclude therefore, that writers in general are more likely to have attended college than are newscaster. 1.Which of the following, if true, most strengthens the argument? A)On average, writers who belong to the National Press Association have had about the same amount of formal education as other writers have had.B)Some of the newscasters who belong to the National Press Association once worked as writers.C)A greater proportion of the writers than of the newscasters in the National Press Association successfully completed college.D)Taken together, writers and newscasters are more likely to have attended college than are people in general.E)A number of the writers in the National Press Association attained graduate degrees in the years after they attended college. 我的答案: A. 正确. XGPR002Editorial Last year in Metron County, more than 75 percent of all school cafeterias, large and small, consistently received the county health department’s “excellent” rating for cleanliness, the highest rating possible.Thus,although 75 percent is far from perfection, at least we know that over three-quarters of the lunches served to children in Metron County school cafeterias were served in conditions of cleanliness that the health authorities rated as “excellent.” The conclusion of the argument is properly drawn if which of the following is assumed? A) Metron County’s health department rates school cafeterias not only on their cleanliness but also on the overall nutritional quality of the meals they serveB)Every year for the past five years, whenever a school cafeteria in Metron County received a rating of“excellent”” for cleanliness, the proportion of students in that school who regularly ate in the cafeteria increased sharply.C)Last year Metron County imposed strict sanctions to ensure that cafeterias receiving less than an“excellent” rating took measures to increase cleanlinessD)Last year, those school cafeterias in Metron County that did not receive an “excellent” rating served fewer lunches, on average, than did school cafeterias in Metron County as a whole.E) In those Metron County schools that do not serve lunches to students, any areas in which students regularly eat lunches are rated for cleanliness by the county health department. 我的答案: D. 正确. xgpr003Along one part of California’s San Andreas Fault, the land sometimes shifts slightly.Some researchers hypothesize that such shifts occur a few days before virtually all earthquakes measuring above 3.3 on the Richter scale of magnitude.Therefore, if these researchers are right, and if such shifts can be reliably detected when they occur, then it is possible to predict, merely by watching for shifts, whether such an earthquake will occur within a few days. 1.The argument is most vulnerable to which of the following criticisms? A) lt does not take into account that slight shifts and earthquakes of magnitude 3.3 or greater might both be caused by some third factor.B) lt treats one particular indicator of earthquakes of a given magnitude as if it were the only such indicator.C) lt mistakes evidence that earthquakes of a given magnitude can be predicted for evidence that all earthquakes can be predicted.D) lt fails to establish that the shifts can be reliably predicted.E) The evidence offered is consistent with the majority of shifts’ not being followed by an earthquake. 我的答案: C. 错误 正确答案: E. 双题0013ln the early nineteenth-century United States, miniature portraits of family members, painted on ivory and typically bestowed on other family members as gifts, became extremely popular, reflecting the growing importance of affection as a family value.The period’s expanding market for miniatures was fueled by the labor of female artists, who charged a fraction of the commissions demanded by their male competitors.Especially in urban areas, middle-class families took advantage of the competitive, gendered labor market to amass multiple representations of kin. Miniatures depicting children, parents, siblings, and other kin heightened the genre’s broadly domestic associations. So, too did the growing number of women who commissioned paintings. While full-sized oil paintings were quite expensive, miniatures were generally attainable for middle-class women, making them affordable luxuries. 1.The passage suggests which of the following about miniature portraits in the nineteenth century? A.They were painted almost exclusively by female artists.B.They more often represented female than male family members.C.Their prices rose because the overall market for paintings by women expanded.D.Their rising popularity reflected an increasing emphasis on the family.E.The ivory on which they were painted made the portraits quite valuable. 我的答案: D. 2.The author discusses “full-sized oil paintings” primarily to A. qualify a claim about the preferences of middle-class art buyersB. account for a choice made by certain individuals who commissioned paintingsC.explain how the subject matter of a painting could affect its priceD.note a change in the market for paintings created by female artistsE.rule out one explanation for the popularity of family portraits. qualify v.修饰,限定 commission v.委任,委托 我的答案: A.正确答案: B. xGPR014More appropriate water pricing would promote the treatment and reuse of urban wastewater for agricultural irrigation and also encourage improvements in irrigation efficiency. Treatment and reuse is more expensive than most irrigation-related conservation and efficiency measures but often less expensive than developing new water sources.Wastewater contains nitrogen and phosphorus, which can be pollutants when released to lakes and rivers but are nutrients when applied to farmland.Moreover, unlike many other water sources,treated wastewater will be both an expanding and fairly reliable supply, since urban water use will likely double by 2025.Many large cities located along coastlines currently dump their wastewater, treated or untreated, into the ocean, rendering it unavailable for any other purpose and harming coastal marine life. 1.Which of the following does the author suggest as an incentive to the development of more efficient irrigation? A) Treatment and reuse of urban wastewaterB) Revised pricing of waterC) Reduced costs for urban wastewater treatmentD) Development of new water sourcesE) Reduced urban water use incentive n.激励,刺激 我的答案: A.正确答案: B. 2.Which of the following does the author present as generally the most cost-effective way of meeting demand for water for irrigation? A) Reducing the amount of water consumed by large citiesB) Treating wastewater that is currently being dumpedC) Increasing the efficiency of current irrigation systemsD) Having new wells drilledE) Increasing the efficiency of current wastewater treatment projects 我的答案: B.正确答案: C. XGPR015The participation of women in the economy of Britain’s North American colonies in the eighteenth century has been underrated because of the assumption that household production could not become commercial.Such an assumption ignores the reality that women produced goods at home for exchange and sale.Barter among neighbors knitted the women of a community into vital trade networks that constituted the underground economy of eighteenth-century colonial North America.Unlike other informal local trade networks in early America, the economy of women never totally ceased to exist. The informal nature of the transactions did not provide the women who made them with much economic power, but it did allow them a small measure of control over how they spent their time. Consider each of the choices separately and select all that apply. 1.According to the passage, the underground economy of women in eighteenth-century colonial North America differed from other informal trade networks in which of the following ways. A) lt continued after other informal trade, networks had disappeared.B) lt did not provide its participants with much economic power.C) lt gave its participants a certain degree of control over how they spent their time. A.B.C. 错了, 选A. BC原文说了, 但是没说其他的informal trade没有这些特点. 2.In the context indicated, “underground” most nearly meansA) subversive 颠覆性的B) secretiveC) subterranean 地下的. 物理意义D) alternativeE) antiestablishment 反对正统流派的 A? 错正确答案: B. underate v.低估 016In California’s Mojave Desert, archaeologists found two fluted projectile points, one on the surface, one buried, both similar to classic Clovis stone points from the American Plains. They obtained a radiocarbon date of 8,470 years from material associated with the buried point, a date far more recent than the known time range for Clovis points. There are three ways of accounting for this date. First, it is possible that fluted points were in use in this region around 8,470 years ago.Second, this point may somehow have been deposited at the California site long after its creation.Third, the 8,470-year date may be wrong: a second date from the same context providing an age of 4,360 years was rejected by archaeologists as incorrect. Consider each of the choices separately and select all that apply. 1.lf the first explanation is the only one of the three that is correct, then it can be inferred that A) the material associated with the buried point and the point itself are not from the same time periodB) there may be other fluted points in the region that date from about 8,470years agoC) the accepted time range for classis Clovis points may need to be reconsidered B. 2.lt can be inferred that the second and the third explanations have which of the following in common? A)Each implies that the known time range for classic Clovis points will need to be revised.B)Each leaves open the possibility that the California fluted points were created contemporaneously with classic Clovis points.C)Each suggests that the radiocarbon dating used at the California site produced unreliable results.D)Each implies that 8.470 years ago, fluted points were more widely used on the American Plains than in the region of the California site.E)Each is based on the assumption that the buried fluted point did not originate at the California site. C. xGPR017At first glance, the nineteenth-century Atlantic halibut fishery fit the typical pattern of fisheries collapse. It followed predictable boom-and-bust cycles of commercial potential, enthusiastic fishing, resource strain,declining productivity and ultimately, collapse. Yet,unlike many other species, halibut was long disdained by fishers and consumers despite its abundance.Lack of commercial value did not entirely protect halibut, since fishers frequently caught halibut along with their target fish, cod, though they discarded halibut as worthless.Between 1840 and 1880, however, consumer demand shifted, elevating halibut to a desirable commodity. The threat to halibut stocks was compounded because fish dealers imposed as election process based on grading the catch, a system that encouraged fishers to jettison all but the highest-graded, most valuable among the fish they caught. 1.The passage implies that a similarity of the time before 1840 and the time after that date was that in both periods A) practices that fish dealers chose to follow had a major impact on the fishing of halibutB) fishers’ practices were completely uninfluenced by size of the populations of their target fishC) many halibut were caught by fishers without ever being brought to marketD) cod populations were more seriously affected by fishing than halibut populations wereE) most fishers preferred to catch cod, when it was accessible, rather than halibut C. 正确答案A. 2.In the context of the passage, the highlighted sentence serves primarily to A) rule out a possible explanation for the timing of a particular historical eventB) identify a historical circumstance that disrupted an otherwise common cycleC) provide a clue that might help to explain an unexpected outcomeD) suggest that a pattern that has widely been considered typical is actually somewhat unusualE) identify what triggered a chain of events that has come to seem predictable C. 正确答案E. 还是需要仔细地理解长句子. XGPR018The hypothesis that paranormal phenomena are real but lie outside the limits of science is supported by considerable evidence.The Society for Psychical Research has collected stories of ordinary people apparently demonstrating paranormal abilities.Entirely anecdotal, this evidence has nothing to do with science, since it cannot be reproduced under controlled conditions.But the society took great trouble to interview first-hand witnesses and to document the stories carefully. One fact that emerges clearly from the stories is that paranormal events occur, if they occur at all, only when people are experiencing strong emotion.This would immediately explain why paranormal phenomena are not observable under theconditions of a well-controlled scientific experiment.Strong emotion is inherently incompatible with controlled scientific procedures. 1.Regarding the evidence collected by the Society for Psychical Research, which of the following can properly be concluded from the passage? A) The society’s attempts to confirm paranormal phenomena using controlled scientific methodology have all been frustrated.B)The society collected stories of paranormal phenomena with the intent of demonstrating the limitations of scientific methodology.C)The society has not documented cases of people apparently able to produce paranormal effects dispassionately and under any given conditions.D)Because the society scrupulously examines and documents the stories it reports, few charlatans attempt to convince the society’s members with fraudulent phenomena.E) When investigation discredits what was claimed to be a paranormal phenomenon, the society does not publicly document the fact. Consider each of the choices separately and select all,that apply. 2.lt can be inferred that the author of the passage would agree with which of the flowing descriptions of the evidence collected by the Society for Psychical Research? A)Carefully recordedB)Unscientificc)Credible 回去背个单词算了…

title: 计算机系统结构01--基础知识
content: 16位寄存器: AX accumulator 累加寄存器 x是extend CX counter DX data BX base 基址寄存器 SP stack pointer BP base pointer SI source index 源变址寄存器 DI destination index 目的变址寄存器 8位寄存器 AL L:low CL DL BL AH H:high CH DH BH 32位寄存器就是在16位寄存器前面加一个E EAX … 剩下的不一个一个写了 段寄存器, 16位, segment register ES extra segment 附加寄存器 CS code segment 代码寄存器 SS stack 栈寄存器 DS data 数据段寄存器 FS 没有名字 GS 没有名字 1MOV BYTE [678] 123 把123放到内存地址678号.可以这么写, 用寄存器中的值指定内存地址, 但是, 只有BX, BP, SI, DI这几个可以. 1BYTE [SI] 如果想把DX指定的内存地址的内容, 赋值给AL的时候, 就要这样: 12MOV BX,DXMOV AL,BYTE [BX] 源数据和目的数据必须相同. 因此可以省略. 1MOV AL, [SI] BIOS = basic input output system ORG是指定程序加载到内存哪个位置 day_03也就是说第一个扇区的512个Byte是BIOS通电后自动就映像到内存中的, 也叫启动区, 利用启动区的512B的空间写一个IPL(initial programme loader), 把剩下的磁盘扇区也映射到内存中. 今天先读了磁盘, 就是把磁盘的内容映像到内存. 扇区是从1号开始的, 所以要从2号开始. 先初始化了一堆寄存器, 其中代表 柱面 磁头 扇区的最好记住然后读第一个扇区, 中间有一小段试错的代码, 然后读到18号扇区, 换一个磁头, 再读, 又读完了, 磁头切换回0, 进入下一个柱面, 重复. 也就是说, 一共读了(如果算上启动区的话): 18 * 512 * 2 * 10 = 184320 B 12345678910111213141516171819202122232425262728293031323334353637383940414243444546474849505152535455565758596061626364656667686970717273747576777879; 程序主体entry: MOV AX,0 ; 初始化寄存器 MOV SS,AX MOV SP,0x7c00 MOV DS,AX; 读取磁盘 MOV AX,0x0820 MOV ES,AX MOV CH,0 ; 柱面0 MOV DH,0 ; 磁头0 MOV CL,2 ; 扇区2readloop: MOV SI,0 ; 记录失败次数寄存器retry: MOV AH,0x02 ; AH=0x02 : 读入磁盘 MOV AL,1 ; 1个扇区 MOV BX,0 MOV DL,0x00 ; A驱动器 INT 0x13 ; 调用磁盘BIOS JNC next ; 没出错则跳转到next ADD SI,1 ; 往SI加1 CMP SI,5 ; 比较SI与5 JAE error ; SI >= 5 跳转到error MOV AH,0x00 MOV DL,0x00 ; A驱动器 INT 0x13 ; 重置驱动器 JMP retrynext: MOV AX,ES ; 把内存地址后移0x200（512/16十六进制转换） ADD AX,0x0020 MOV ES,AX ; ADD ES,0x020因为没有ADD ES，只能通过AX进行 ADD CL,1 ; 往CL里面加1 CMP CL,18 ; 比较CL与18 JBE readloop ; CL <= 18 跳转到readloop MOV CL,1 ADD DH,1 CMP DH,2 JB readloop ; DH < 2 跳转到readloop MOV DH,0 ADD CH,1 CMP CH,CYLS JB readloop ; CH < CYLS 跳转到readloop; 读取完毕，跳转到haribote.sys执行！ MOV [0x0ff0],CH ; IPLがどこまで読んだのかをメモ JMP 0xc200error: MOV SI,msgputloop: MOV AL,[SI] ADD SI,1 ; 给SI加1 CMP AL,0 JE fin MOV AH,0x0e ; 显示一个文字 MOV BX,15 ; 指定字符颜色 INT 0x10 ; 调用显卡BIOS JMP putloopfin: HLT ; 让CPU停止，等待指令 JMP fin ; 无限循环msg: DB 0x0a, 0x0a ; 换行两次 DB "load error" DB 0x0a ; 换行 DB 0 RESB	0x7dfe-$ ; 填写0x00直到0x001fe DB 0x55, 0xaa 上图中, 第二个扇区映像到内存中的位置从0x08200而不是0x08000开始, 据B站一个up说是因为想让1号扇区看起来像是加载到0x08000位置(尽管其实不是) 512用16进制表示是0x0200, 也就是比如从0x07c00开始读一个扇区, 要读到0x07dff python版OS这只是一个用python模拟的OS软件, 并不是真正的OS. 内存管理模块data – 模拟数据属性: 数据内容. for example: 长度为40的string. 数据大小. for example: 大小是10 B. 方法: access(start, offset) 计算step, step的含义即一个字节能表示多少字.access的start和offset都说的是字节.比如我们要访问10 ~ 30 字节, 我要先算出来, 这些字节表示了多少个字, 然后再把string中的这些字显示出来. 12345678class Data: def __init__(self, string, size): self.string = string self.size = size def access(self, start, offset): step = len(self.string) / self.size return self.string[int(start * step): int((start + offset) * step)] page – 模拟内存页这里, 有点儿难看懂 12if sflag != -1 and sflag == eflag: return self.content.get(self.usedAddress[sflag][0]).access(offset - self.usedAddress[sflag][0], length) 其实是这样的: 首先content是一个字典, key是首地址, value 是 上面定义的data对象. 那么, content.get就得到了一个data对象, data.access获得相应的数据(string) 最后为什么access的参数是: offset - self.usedAddress[sflag][0], length 呢? 那是因为要换成相对的, 对于一个string来说, 开始就是0, 长度就是string.len. 而data的access方法的参数是start(字节), offset(字节). 对于一个页面来说, 我offset - start得到我的相对偏移量, 然后访问字节的长度是length. 总之最终返回的是string. 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051525354555657585960616263646566676869707172737475767778798081828384858687888990919293949596979899100101102103104105106107108109110111112113114115116117118119120121122123124125126127128129from .data import Datafrom .string_operation import cutStringclass Page: def __init__(self, pageSize=16): self.maxSize = pageSize # if have used self.used = 0 # [[(Start, End)], 标志哪些部分的地址被使用 self.usedAddress = [(pageSize + 1, pageSize + 2)] # 键为数据首地址， 值为数据 self.content = {} # 页内访问,从偏移量开始访问length,返回字符串 def access(self, offset, length): # 越界 if offset + length > self.maxSize or offset < 0: return -1 if length == 0: return -1 # 对已经被占用的部分, 按照起始地址排序 self.usedAddress.sort(key=lambda x: x[0]) # 找起点和终点落在页内哪一段(start,end)区间 start = offset end = offset + length sflag = -1 eflag = -1 for i in range(len(self.usedAddress)): if self.usedAddress[i][0] <= start <= self.usedAddress[i][1]: sflag = i if self.usedAddress[i][0] <= end <= self.usedAddress[i][1]: eflag = i data = [] endData = "" startData = "" # 落在同一段区间 if sflag != -1 and sflag == eflag: return self.content.get(self.usedAddress[sflag][0]).access(offset - self.usedAddress[sflag][0], length) # 没有落在同一段区间, 就把start ~ end中每一段被使用了的数据都加入, 连同startdata 和 enddata一同返回 if sflag != -1: startData = self.content.get(self.usedAddress[sflag][0]).access(offset - self.usedAddress[sflag][0], self.usedAddress[sflag][1] - offset + 1) start = self.usedAddress[sflag][1] if eflag != -1: endData = self.content.get(self.usedAddress[eflag][0]).access(0, end - self.usedAddress[eflag][0]) end = self.usedAddress[eflag][0] - 1 begin = -1 last = -1 for i in range(len(self.usedAddress)): if self.usedAddress[i][0] > start and begin == -1: begin = i if self.usedAddress[i][0] > end and last == -1: last = i if begin != -1 and last != -1: for i in range(begin, last): data.append(self.content.get(self.usedAddress[i][0]).access(0, self.usedAddress[i][1] - self.usedAddress[i][0] + 1)) return startData + "".join(data) + endData # 从offset开始写入Length,内容为string def write(self, offset, length, string): if offset + length > self.maxSize or offset < 0: return -1 if length == 0: return -1 self.usedAddress.sort(key=lambda x: x[0]) start = offset end = offset + length sflag = -1 eflag = -1 for i in range(len(self.usedAddress)): if self.usedAddress[i][0] <= start <= self.usedAddress[i][1]: sflag = i if self.usedAddress[i][0] <= end <= self.usedAddress[i][1]: eflag = i if sflag != -1 and sflag == eflag: start1 = self.usedAddress[sflag][0] end1 = self.usedAddress[sflag][1] strings1 = cutString([offset - start1, length, end1 - length - offset + 1], self.content.get(start1).string) self.free(self.usedAddress[sflag]) self.writeOne(start1, offset - start1, strings1[0]) self.writeOne(offset + length, end1 - length - offset + 1, strings1[2]) else: start1 = self.usedAddress[sflag][0] end1 = self.usedAddress[sflag][1] start2 = self.usedAddress[eflag][0] end2 = self.usedAddress[eflag][1] if sflag != -1: strings2 = cutString([offset - start1, end1 - offset + 1], self.content.get(start1).string) self.free((start1, end1)) self.writeOne(start1, offset - start1, strings2[0]) if eflag != -1: strings3 = cutString([offset + length - start2, end2 - offset - length + 1], self.content.get(start2).string) self.free((start2, end2)) self.writeOne(offset + length, end2 - offset - length + 1, strings3[1]) self.usedAddress.sort(key=lambda x: x[0]) remove = [] for i in self.usedAddress: if i[0] >= offset and i[1] <= end - 1: remove.append(i) for i in remove: self.free(i) self.writeOne(offset, length, string) # 向page中的某一段连续空间start,end写入数据 def writeOne(self, offset, length, string): self.usedAddress.append((offset, offset + length - 1)) self.content[offset] = Data(string, length) # 清空useAddress, 清空content def free(self, ret): self.usedAddress.remove(ret) self.content.pop(ret[0]) memory – 模拟内存内存中有128页, 每页16kb. 通过一个列表memory表示, 页表中的每个元素都是page对象. access 和 write 是只能对 单页 进行.malloc 是可以分配多个页面. 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051525354555657585960import copyimport mathfrom .page import Pageclass Memory: def __init__(self, pageSize=16, pageNum=128): self.maxPage = pageNum self.pageSize = pageSize # record used memory, kb self.used = 0 self.maxMem = pageSize * pageNum # [how many use:<= pageSize] self.memory = [Page(pageSize) for i in range(self.maxPage)] def access(self, address, length): page = address // self.pageSize # 在第几个页面上 if page >= self.maxPage or length > self.pageSize: return -1 offset = address % self.pageSize # 在某个页面上的偏移量 if offset + length > self.pageSize: return -1 return self.memory[page].access(offset, length) def malloc(self, size): if size == 0: size = self.pageSize if self.used + size > self.maxMem: return -1 ret = [] num = math.ceil(size / self.pageSize) # 计算要分匹配多少页, 向上取整. # 遍历所有空闲页面, 返回ret[] 保存页号. for i in range(len(self.memory)): if self.memory[i].used == 0: self.memory[i].used = 1 self.used += self.pageSize ret.append(i) num -= 1 if num == 0: return ret # 把ret[] 列表中的页号全部释放. def free(self, ret): for i in ret: self.memory[i] = Page(self.pageSize) def copy(self, num, page): self.memory[num] = copy.deepcopy(page)	# 对单页的写. def write(self, address, length, string): page = address // self.pageSize if page >= self.maxPage or length > self.pageSize: return -1 offset = address % self.pageSize if offset + length > self.pageSize: return -1 self.memory[page].write(offset, length, string) Process Manager – 进程管理虚拟内存: 这是个小重点: 12345678910# 动态分配,缺页率过高时增加lru表 def ifAddLru(self, step=10, threshold=0.4): # 访存次数过少，没有参考意义 if self.accessTimes < step * self.maxLru: return # 无需每次访存都判断，step次访存判断一次 if self.accessTimes % step != 0: return if self.lostPage / self.accessTimes > threshold and self.maxLru < self.lrupper: self.maxLru += 1 解释:默认一个进程可以有8个虚拟page, 如果缺页率过高, 则通过增加page方式来缓解, 但最多加到12个. maxLru是目前一个进程可以有多少个虚拟内存页面 也不是每次都判断, 首先访存次数少, 统计缺页率没有意义.第二, step次才判断一回, 每个进程持有的虚拟内存页面数并不会迅速增长. swapPage函数也是一个重点, 最后返回结果那里含义暂不明确. 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748495051525354555657585960616263646566676869707172737475767778798081828384858687888990919293949596979899100101102103104import math# 每个进程的单独管理,包括页表,使用的内存量等class ProcessManager: def __init__(self, defaultLru=8, pageSize=16, lrupper=12): self.maxAddress = -1 self.pageSize = pageSize # [-1, -1, 0, 0] -> [虚存页号， 物理内存页号， 有效位， 是否在物理内存中被修改], 数组下标为页号 self.table = [] self.lru = [] self.maxLru = defaultLru self.lostPage = 0 self.accessTimes = 0 self.lrupper = lrupper # {文件名: [首地址, 大小, 块号, 是否代码段]} self.file = {} # 增加页表项,配合内存的申请 def add(self, ret): for i in ret: self.table.append([i, -1, 0, 0]) self.maxAddress += self.pageSize # 检查访问/写入地址是否合法 def ifPolicy(self, address, length): if address < 0 or address + length - 1 > self.maxAddress: return -1 return 0 # 释放页表 def free(self, address, length): ret = self.findAllPage(address, length) result = [] flag = 0 for i in ret: result.append([self.table[i - flag][0], self.table[i - flag][1]]) self.table.pop(i - flag) if i in self.lru: self.lru.remove(i) flag += 1 return result # 根据地址和长度找出所有需要访问的虚拟页 def findAllPage(self, address, length): return [i + address // self.pageSize for i in range(0, math.ceil((length + address % self.pageSize) / self.pageSize))] # 找出所访问内容是否在物理内存中,如果在返回物理页号，否则返回虚拟页号 def ifInPhyMem(self, address, length): ret = self.findAllPage(address, length) result = [] for i in ret: if self.table[i][2] == 1: result.append([1, self.table[i][1]]) # self.table[i][1]是物理内存页号 else: result.append([0, i]) # i 就是虚拟页号 return result # 传入虚拟页，换页，传回参数给管理模块调度 def swaPage(self, page): self.ifAddLru() # 访存次数加一 self.accessTimes += 1 if page in self.lru and self.table[page][2] == 1: self.lru.remove(page) self.lru.append(page) return [1, self.table[page][1]] # 用于计算缺页率 self.lostPage += 1 # 当前的进程持有的虚拟内存页数没有满, 直接加进来 if len(self.lru) < self.maxLru: self.lru.append(page) return [0, [[-1], [page, self.table[page][0]]]] else: lost = self.lru.pop(0) self.lru.append(page) return [0, [[lost, self.table[lost][1], self.table[lost][3], self.table[lost][0]], [page, self.table[page][0]]]] # 字如其名 def modify(self, page, flag, value): self.table[page][flag] = value # 动态分配,缺页率过高时增加lru表 def ifAddLru(self, step=10, threshold=0.4): # 访存次数过少，没有参考意义 if self.accessTimes < step * self.maxLru: return # 无需每次访存都判断，step次访存判断一次 if self.accessTimes % step != 0: return if self.lostPage / self.accessTimes > threshold and self.maxLru < self.lrupper: self.maxLru += 1 # 记录存入了哪些文件 def addFile(self, name, address, size, block, flag): self.file[name] = [address, size, block, flag]

title: 计算机系统结构01--基础知识
content: 第二讲 – 单元测试 Linux 超级用户: root 几点几分: date 获取进程占用逻辑内存大小: ps, top 了解CPU空闲情况: top, vmstat 使用more逐行显示文本文件, 向上滚动一行: 回车 计数: wc -l 管道: 将前一个命令的输出, 作为下一个命令的输入 系统创建用户时, 可以指定用户登录成功后执行哪个命令, 一般是shell, 也可以是自己开发的软件, 甚至是shutdown. Linux区分大小写 Linux 中 root用户不能读普通用户的 口令(password) 但是可以强制更改 ps列出进程启动时间STIME和占用CPU时间TIME, 一般来说TIME值等于当前时间减去STIME. – 错的! Linux 把物理终端和虚拟终端都处理成设备文件, 只要写这个文件, 就会把数据发送到终端显示屏上. free 命令报告处于free状态的内存非常低, 这意味着系统内存配置不足. – 错的. uniq -d 是只输出重复的行. uniq 是 重复的行只输出一次. 注意什么叫重复的行. less 比 more功能强大 tee可以实现屏幕共享功能 tr 字节, 唯有0无法转义. – 错的. uniq命令中的重复的行是指, 相邻的重复, 下面的例子中, 第一行和第四行不叫重复. LinuxLinuxWindowsLinux tr可以将256种字节值中任何一种取值翻译巍另一个字节值, 并且不限于可打印字符. bc计算器的使用. 直接执行bc 默认没有小数点 od -c 可打印字符, 不可打印字符打印ASCI, 都能打, 十六进制方式. tail -f 实时监测文件尾部追加的内容, 看日志有用. 正则表达式 正则表达式与文件名通配符规则不同 不同软件对正则表达式定义不同 元字符 . * [ \ ^ $ 其他字符与其自身匹配 转义 end\ . 与 end. 匹配 \ 后面除了 6 种元字符, 不应该出现任何其他字符, 比如不应该 \ u . 匹配任意单字符 [ abcd ] 匹配abcd中任意单字符 [ \ * .] 代表他们自己 [A - Z] 区间 想表示 减号, 只能放在最后[ ad- ] 用^表示补集 [ ^a-z ] 匹配任一非小写字母 ^ 不在开头, 失去表示补集的意义 * : 表示闭包 0次或者任意多次 12 * 4 与 14, 124, 122224, 12224匹配 但是与1234 不匹配

title: 计算机系统结构01--基础知识
content: 这门课期末成绩65%, 真是离了大谱 第一章: 交换概论交换的概念通信网三要素 交换设备：包括各类交换机和交叉连接设备。 传输设备：包括用户线路、中继线路、信号转换设备。（如：双绞线、电缆、光缆、基站无线收发设备、光电转换器、卫星、微波等） 终端设备：包括电话机、智能终端、智能外设等用户终端设备。 三个概念 信息传递 时分复用 带宽分配 时分复用 同步时分复用 1帧 = 32时隙(共125微秒,携带256比特), 一个时隙=3.9 微秒, 一个时隙携带8bit PCM PCM 的意思就是脉冲编码调制，现在的数字传输系统都是采用 PCM 体制。PCM 设备是利用 2M 线路传输的，所以 PCM 链路也可以理解为是 2M 线。 E1 就是采用 PCM 技术的，具体说是 PCM30/32，总共 32 个时隙。除了 0 和 16 时隙用于传输其它数据外，1-15 和 17-31 路时隙均可以传输话音或其它有效数据，每路速率为 64K，所以一条 E1 就是 2048kbps，即 2M。 PCM 线可以称为同轴电缆、双绞线或为 2M 线。2M 线可以是电信上租用的，也可以是光端机上输出的。 欧洲的 30 路脉码调制 PCM 简称E1，速率是 2.048Mbit/s 。中国采用的是欧洲的 E1 标准。 E1 的一个时分复用帧（其长度 T=125us）共划 分为 32 相等的时隙，时隙的编号为 CH0CH31。其中时隙 CH0 用作帧同步用，时隙 CH16 用来传送信令，剩下 CH1CH15 和 CH17~CH31 共 30 个时隙用作 30 个话路。每个时隙传送 8bit，因此共用 256bit。每秒传送 1s / 125us = 8000 个帧，因此 PCM 一次群 E1 的数据率就是 8000 * 256bit = 2048K bit/s = 2.048Mbit/s。 1、一条E1是 2.048M 的链路，用 PCM 编码。2、一个 E1 的帧长为 256 个 bit,分为 32 个时隙，一个时隙为 8 个 bit。3、每秒有 8k 个 E1 的帧通过接口，即 8K * 256=2048kbps。4、每个时隙在 E1 帧中占 8bit，8 * 8k=64k，即一条 E1 中含有 32 个 64K。 总结：E1(电信标准)： 采用同步时分复用技术将 30 个语音信道和 2 个控制信道复合在一条 2.048Mbit/s 的高速信道上。E1 线 ≈2M 线 ≈PCM 线，都是支持欧洲的 30 路脉冲编码调制 PCM，线路速率是 2.048Mbit/s 的同轴电缆。PCM 设备是利用 2M 线路传输的，所以 PCM 链路也可以理解为是 2M 线。 异步时分复用 标志化信道：标志码表示哪路信息。 分组长度可变或不可变，分组头用于定界。 统计复用提高信道利用率。 带宽分配 固定带宽分配 动态带宽分配 信息传递 面向连接工作方式：连接建立——信息传送——连接释放 无连接工作方式：边寻址边传递讯息 各种交换方式 CTM（Circuit Transfer Mode，电路传送模式）：电路交换，多速率电路交换、快速电路交换 PTM（Packet ……，分组传送模式）：分组交换、帧交换、帧中继 ATM（Asynchronous ……，异步传送模式）：ATM 交换、IP 交换、光交换、MPLS、软交换、IMS 电路交换 电路交换（CS）电话通信中信息的传送方式：公共交换电话网（Public Switched Telephone Network，PSTN） 每一路能提供 64k 速率。 信息传送的最小单位是时隙 面向连接的工作方式（物理连接） 同步时分复用（固定带宽分配） 无差错控制机制（实时性强） 对通信信息不作处理（透明传输） 流量控制基于呼叫损失制 适合实时性、恒定速率的业务。 多速率电路交换（MRCS） 采用同步时分复用方式，将多个 64k 信道捆绑起来形成一个速率更高的信道。不同速率的信道经过分路在不同的交换网络中进行交换。 缺点：速率是事先定好的，而且速率类型不能太多，否则控制和交换网络会非常复杂。 快速电路交换（FCS） 只在信息需要传送时才建立物理连接，提高了带宽利用率，但控制复杂，灵活性不如帧中继和 ATM 交换。 分组交换（PS）——存储转发传输时延+存储时延+处理和排队时延 报文交换 分组交换：在报文交换存储转发的基础上使用分组减小时延 虚电路（virtual circuit）： 面向连接。 使用逻辑子信道（Logic Channel Number，LCN），在交换节点路由表上记录出入端口。 应用：PSPDN 网络 数据报： 无连接。 使用标示来区分数据报，可变速率。 分组交换的特点： 信息传送的最小单位是分组 面向连接（逻辑连接）方式和无连接方式。 统计时分复用，动态分配带宽。 有差错控制机制。 对通信信息作处理。 流量控制基于呼叫延迟制。 虚电路 数据报 分组头 简单（逻辑信道号） 选路 虚连接表 分组顺序 有序 故障敏感性 敏感 应用 连续数据流 为什么数据通信网采用分组交换方式？ ——可靠性要求高、可变速率的数据业务（实时性相对电路交换较差） 帧交换（FS）分组交换基于 X.25 协议，包含物理层、数据链路层和分组层——导致信息通过交换节点的延迟增加，无法满足高速数据通信。 而帧交换协议栈只有物理层和数据链路层，加快处理。

title: 计算机系统结构01--基础知识
content: 概念类: 酒店, 房间, 顾客, 前台, 空调, 蒲扇, 酒店经理, 空调管理员, 账单 办理入住流程 使用空调服务流程 办理结账流程 顾客在前台办理入住, 需要提供身份信息, 预计住宿的时间和需求房型. 提供单人标准200元/晚, 单人豪华400元/晚, 双人标准300元/晚, 双人豪华500元/晚. 如果存在空房间, 则分配房间号和房卡(一串密码); 否则拒绝客户请求, 并提供其他选择. 入住后: 可以续住 可以提前退 住宿截止后自动开启结款业务. 用例编号 用例名称 参与者 001 操作空调 客人 002 关闭中央空调 空调管理员 003 打开中央空调 空调管理员 004 监控所有空调运行情况 空调管理员 005 办理结账 前台 006 出售蒲扇 酒店管理员 角色 角色与系统关系 客人 主要使用酒店管理系统房间内的空调控制面板,以使用空调 前台 使用系统前台服务功能 空调管理员 使用系统空调监测面板 酒店管理员 使用系统后台账单面板 序号 概念类 关系说明 1 Hotel(酒店) reception(前台) room(房间) cooling_system(纳凉系统) 酒店由 酒店员工,房间 和 纳凉系统 构成. 2 hotel_manager(酒店经理),hotel_controlpanel(酒店控制面板),bill(账单) 酒店经理 依赖 酒店控制面板 查看每个房间的 账单 3 ac_manager(空调管理员) ac_controlpanel(空调控制面板) 空调管理员 依赖 空调控制面板 查看每个空调的状态. 4 room(房间) ac_queue(空调等待队列) air_conditioner(空调) 房间 可以发起请求 进入空调等待队列 等待使用 空调 资源. 5 cooling_system(纳凉系统) fan(蒲扇) air_conditioner(空调) 纳凉系统 由 蒲扇 和 空调 实现. 6 酒店员工, 酒店管理员, 空调管理员, 前台 酒店员工 由 酒店管理员, 空调管理员和前台 实现 7 前台, 房间 前台与房间关联, 前台可以查询空闲房间 8 房间, 账单 房间与账单关联, 房间产生的各项费用都记录在账单中

title: 计算机系统结构
content: 范围 第一章 第二章 2.6 第三章 3.3(不考) 第四章 第五章 6.1 6.3 第9章 第10章 10.1 10.2 10.3 10.5 第13章 考核方式没有期中考试, 期末考试占60%, 平时成绩40%. 想分高肯定需要平时成绩搞一搞加分. 第一章知识点总结 层次结构 计算机系统结构定义 计算机组成 计算机实现 Flynn分类法 冯氏分类法 Handler分类法 模拟和仿真的概念 大概率事件优先原理 程序局部性原理 Amdahl定律, Sn, Fe < 1, Se > 1 CPU性能公式: 程序执行时间 = IC(指令条数) * CPI(平均每条指令所需周期数) * t(一个周期所需时间) CPI = (总时钟周期数) / IC(指令条数) MIPS(每秒百万条指令数) = 指令条数 / 总执行时间 性能评价(次重点) 第一章视频 10min 只讲概念 第二章我原来没看懂的点: 解决瓶颈. 第一种方法是分得更细, 原本S2需要3t时间, 现在我把它拆分成3个1t时间, 流水线的段数变多了, 但是其他步骤就不用等待. 第二种方法是 资源重复, 每一个资源干这件事仍然需要3t, 但是我可以找3个资源, 干3件事. 时空图如下: 这个例题挺好的:分3步: 设计怎么算 画时空图 计算加速比, 效率, 吞吐率. MIPS5段流水线 IF：Instruction Fetch（指令获取） ID：Instruction Decode（指令解码） EX：Execution（执行） MEM：Memory Access（存储器访问） WB：Write Back（写回） 计算机系统的层次结构：计算机是由硬件、软件、固件（固化的微程序）组成的复杂系统，按机器语言功能划分为多级层次结构。 下面两级（微程序级、传统机器语言机器级）使用硬件/固件实现，称为物理机。上面四级由软件实现，称为虚拟机。第二级（传统机器语言级）是软硬件界面。 层数 语言 实现 0 布尔语言（硬件） 1 微程序指令 用微指令集编写微程序，固件、硬件来解释 2 传统机器语言 传统机器语言程序有 L1 级微程序或 L0 级硬联逻辑进行解释 3 操作系统 包括传统机器及操作系统级指令，由微程序解释 4 汇编语言 翻译成 L3 和 L2 级语言执行 5 高级语言 通过编译程序翻译到 L4 或 L3 级，或通过解释方法实现 6 应用语言 由应用程序包翻译到 L5 翻译和解释：一般情况，上述六级层次的 L1-L3 用解释实现，而 L4-L6 用翻译实现。 翻译：用转换程序把高一级机器上的程序转换为低一级机器上的等效程序，然后再在这低一级机器上运行。速度快、占用空间大。 解释：对于高一级机器上程序中的每一条语句或指令，转换为低级语言的一段等效程序执行，执行完后再去高一级机器取下一条语句或指令。速度慢、占用空间小。 Amdahl定律Fe = 0.4 Se = 10 Tn = T0 * (1 - Fe + Fe / Se) = 0.64T0Sn = T0 / Tn = 1 / 0.64 = 1.5625 提高0.5625 CPU性能假设FP指令的比例为25%，其中，FPSQR占全部指令的比例为2%,FP操作的CPI为4,FPSQR操作的CPI为20，其他指令的平均CPI为1.33。 现有两种改进方案:第一种是把 FPSQR操作的CPI 减至2，第二种是把所有的FP操作的CPI 减至2，试比较两种方案对系统性能的提高程度。 解: FPSQR 也属于 FP指令. 改进前CPI = 4 * 0.25 + 1.33 * 0.75 = 1.9975第一种改进, CPI_1 = CPI - (20 - 2) * 0.02 = 1.6375第二种改进: CPI_2 = 2 * 0.35 + 1.33 * 0.75 = 1.4975 从CPI角度, 第二种好. 流水线: 吞吐率,加速比,效率 $$TP = \frac{n}{T_k}$$ TP 是 ThroughPut 吞吐率 n是总指令数 k是一个指令需要多少步:这里是三步:取指,译码,执行 $T_k$是执行指令的总时间 $$T_k = (k + n - 1) * \Delta t$$ k * t 是第一条指令执行完所花费的时间 (n - 1) * t 是因为指令都是接踵而至的, 所以第一条指令执行完还有n - 1条指令没有执行, 所以是n-1 t 是时钟周期 思路永远是: 先算第一条指令, 再算剩下n-1条指令. 每个步骤执行时间不相等也是一样的, 如下图. $$加速比:S=\frac{顺序时间T_s}{流水线时间T_k}=\frac{nk\Delta t}{(k + n - 1) * \Delta t}$$ 求最大吞吐率还是最大加速比都是让指令条数n趋近于无穷求一个极限. $$效率:E = \frac{n个任务占用的有效面积}{对应总面积} = \frac{n * \Delta t * k}{(k + n - 1) * \Delta t * k}$$ 面积就是底乘高 高就是k

title: 无题
content: 无题自作自受, 明明什么也没发生, 或者是你真的把她删了, 其实是一个新的开始, 是一个你向前看的好契机, 你却让自己这么这么伤心, 杨智程我今天早上梦见被智若琦发QQ空间骂, 后来醒了感慨现实生活正常得多. 我一想到刘的身材我还是会特别特别难受, 我总觉得那完美的身材本应该是属于我的. 错误的想法罢了, 不许再加深这种想法了. 好身材的女孩子很多吧, 或许. 虽然没上课, 但是今天实实在在的有在做事情, 知道自己应该做什么事情的日子是至少不慌张的. 明天我希望能在上体育课之前做点事情. 我现在的状态是, 等待开奖, 等待状态: 每天学学 系统结构 or 现代交换 这种文科, 做做项目java牛客论坛, 再读读30天OS. 就这样吧.

title: 清明前夕
content: 明天计划 英语优先, 现在已经找到思路 然后是系统结构 然后是Redis 然后是移动互联网

title: GRE填空14
content: 题目源来自xxgg 6 选 2XGsC0111The fact that no single Cantonese dictionary is seen as____is one of the main reasons why most Hong Kong authors do not depend on formal reference tools when writing in Cantonese. A) dependableB) authoritativeC) meticulousD) indefiniteE) topicalF) comprehensive AB. dependable adj.可靠的 authoritative adj.权威的 Cantonese n.广东话 xGSC0112Because it has usually been impossible to eradicate exotic species once they have become established, it is____ to minimize introductions of species that have substantial probabilities of unwanted impacts. A) prudentB) customaryC) provident adj.有先见之明的D) superfluousE) essentialF) pointless 选AC. C明显比E要更好. eradicate v.根除, 消灭 xGSC0113The biographer laments the___that abound in texts from antiquity they are so prevalent, she says that they nearly amount to a “conspiracy of silence.”A) fallacies n.谬误B) mythsC) misrepresentationsD) elisions n.省略E) lacunae n.缺失F) distortions n.曲解 lament n. 挽歌，悼文 v. 对……感到悲痛，对……表示失望；抱怨 conspiracy n. 阴谋，密谋；阴谋集团 antiquity n. 古代 选DE. 复习单词了. xGSC0114Meteorology is one of the few fields of applied science that demands prediction; since prediction involves considerable uncertainty and uncertainty is ___scientists, meteorology will continue to exist in afraught intellectual space. A) mysterious toB) anathema toC) discredited byD) pivotal forE) repellent toF) familiar to anathema n.可恨的事物 repellent adj.令人讨厌的 pivotal adj.中枢的,关键的 选BE. 讨厌的. xGsc0115Faced with so much conflicting information on the internet, many people come to believe that all sources are so____ that efforts to discriminate between the true and the false are inevitably futile.A) slantedB) impreciseC) spleneticD) tendentiousE) surreptitiousF) acrimonious ambivalent adj.有矛盾情绪的 acrimonious adj.尖刻的 选AD. 有偏见的, 有倾向性的. xGSC0116This novel is not great literature: there are too many characters, too many subplots, and no clearly defined protagonist, making for___story. A) a banalB) a diffuse adj.冗长的, 含混不清的C) a mawkishD) an innocuousE) an amorphous adj.无定形的F) a hackneyed 选BE. xGSC0117Over the past hundred years, numerous experiments on elementary particles have___the classical paradigm of a causal, deterministic universe by showing that some natural phenomena are truly random. A) augmentedB) supportedC) upendedD) investigatedE) underminedF) probed – probe v.探查,盘问 casual adj. 休闲的 causal adj. 因果的 选CE. 因为前面说宇宙是因果和确定的, 后面说证明了一些现象真的是随机的. 所以应该填写 推翻, 损害. xGSC0118Recent research has shown that memories are not unchanging physical races in the brain; instead, they are constructs that are___, rebuilt every time they are recalled. A) complexB) intricateC) fragile adj.易碎的,虚弱的D) malleableE) ephemeralF) pliable adj.柔韧的,柔软的 选DF. 中遇蒙对一个. F选项 pliable注意含义. xGSC0119Ancient coins displayed in museums are almost by definition___, on display precisely because they are the most beautiful, the most elaborate,and the best-preserved samples. A) diverseB) atypicalC) PreciousD) exceptionalE) disparateF) enigmatic adj.神秘的 BD. exceptional 杰出的,例外的. xGSCo120An academic with a questionable record in either teaching, administration, or research may still be well regarded at many schools, but simultaneous failure in all three areas normally results in_____by superiors.A) exculpationB) dismissal n.开除,免职C) impeachment n.弹劾,控告D) disapprobationE) censure superior n.上司,上级 选DE. xGSco121The airline might receive fewer complaints if it got passengers to their destinations on time: in the past few years, only one airline has been more___ A) unprofitableB) aggressive adj.好斗的C) remiss adj.疏忽的,懈怠的D) dilatory adj.拖拉的E) impeccable adj.无错误的,无瑕疵的F) assiduous adj.勤奋的 选择EF. xGSCo122The author argues that by setting the agenda, constraining the issues discussed, and crafting “talking points,” political elites are ultimately able to____ the the choices available to voters.A. explicate v.解释B. obfuscate v.使模糊,使迷乱C. demarcate v.给…划定界限D. multiplyE. widenF. circumscribe v.限制 根据 constrain 选出FC. 限制之意. xGSC0123Laboratory experiments testing whether memories can be purposely erased or implanted seem decidedly____ compared to the sensational depictions of memory manipulation in movies, but such research has nevertheless yielded dramatic results. A) sinister adj.凶兆的B) outdatedC) ominous adj.凶兆的,不吉利的D) prosaic adj.普通的E) frivolous adj.愚蠢而不严肃的F) pedestrian adj.平凡的,普通的 选DF. 好像做过, 说的是实验室跟电影相比显得很平凡. xGSC0124The landmasses that form our continents are notably____: they are plates of rock continuously shifting around within the Earth’s crust, in movements that are not just horizontal but also vertical. A) coordinatedB) dispersed adj.散布的C) itinerant adj.巡回的,流动的D) ancientE) peripatetic adj.巡回的,流动的F) scattered adj.分散的,零散的 landmass n.陆地地块选CE. 单词题. xGSC0125Although Wanda Coleman’s sonnets sometimes employ____word choices, they aptly bring to the fore a distinctly modern anxiety. A) ambiguousB) archaicC) puzzlingD) surprisingE) fustyF) disturbing BE. 根据后面modern, 前面选 过时的,古老的 取反. xGSC0126The actor was quick to warn new member of the cast that the director’s cherubic countenance belied___ temperament. A) a deceitful adj.欺骗的B) a choleric adj.易怒的,暴躁的C) a moroseD) an imperious adj.专横的E) a vengeful adj.复仇的F) an irascible adj.易怒的 cherubic adj.可爱的,天使的 countenance n.面容,表情 v.支持,拥护 选 BF. xGSC0127The fear that otherwise___ economies could fall victim to external shocks is one of the scariest aspects of the world’s economic troubles and one of the most portentous. A) insignificantB) smallC) progressiveD) robustE) matureF) healthy 选DF. 挺奇怪的, 不知道这个句子咋理解的. 翻译成 原本 健康强壮的经济可能… portentous adj.不祥的 xGsc0128Proponents of the legislation argued that its critics’ valid but minor points did not___ the assertion that the bill would be far more beneficial than hurtful to the nation’s citizens. A) revoke v.撤销,撤回B) bolster v.增强,巩固C) vitiate v.损害D) undercut v.削弱E) address v.做演讲F) legitimize proponent n.支持者 minor adj.较小的,次要的 选CD. xGSC0129Even though no other urban center on Earth thrived for so long, the ancient Mesopotamian city of Uruk remains____ in comparison with its more famous neighbor, Babylon. A) prominent adj.显著的,杰出的B) obscureC) unknownD) ornate adj.华丽的,装饰的E) popularF) prosperous adj.繁荣的,兴旺的 BC. xGSc0130There are several strange__ in the book India; for instance, though subtitled An Intimate Biography of 1.2 Billion People, it finds no place for the nearly 800 million Indians who depend on agriculture for a living. A) elisions n.省略B) omissions n.省略,删除,疏忽C) censuresD) critiques n.评论E) biasesF) digressions n.离题 选AB. xGSc0131The rebellion was____ one, driven less by ardor than by reason and calculation. A) a cerebralB) a dispassionate adj.不动感情的,冷静的C) a rash adj.轻率的,鲁莽的D) an idealisticE) a cautiousF) a reckless adj.鲁莽的 rebellion n.叛乱,起义 ardor n.热情,狂热 选AB. 注意E的意思还是和冷静不太一样. xGSC0132The scholars’ hypothesis challenges the scope of human psychological and behavioral universals, but does not dispense with them entirely: the team remains confident that displays of pride, for instance, are___. A) inheritedB) pernicious adj.有害的C) ubiquitousD) symptomatic adj.有症状的,作为征兆的E) detrimentalF) omnipresent dispense with sth. 摈弃,不再需要 选 CF. 翻译: 学者们的假设挑战了人类心理和行为共性的范围，但并没有完全废除它们:例如，研究小组仍然相信，骄傲的表现无处不在 xGSc0133The vast majority of universities in the United States promote themselves as institutions of free speech and thought, construing censorship as___ their search for knowledge. A) subordinate toB) obviated byC) secondary toD) antipathetic to adj.厌恶的; 反感的E) conducive to 有助于F) inconsistent with adj.不一致 construe v.理解,领会,诠释 censorship n.审查,检查 conductive adj.对…有助益的 选DF. xGSC0134Conditions at the training camp for runners were___; few of the runners had proper shoes or a training kit.A) unpleasantB) tediousC) spartanD) austereE) rigorous adj.严格的F) monotonous adj.乏味的 CD. xGSCo135The geometry student struggled with the request to demonstrate the____ proposition, feeling that, since opposite angles were self-evidently equal, there was no need for a proof.A) patent adj.明显的B) nebulous adj.模糊的C) arcaneD) manifest v.显示,表明 adj.明显的E) illogicalF) plausible AD. xGSC0136A danger of writing urban history is the temptation to fall into the ___ and then to learn that only a rare few will be interested in reading your overly specialized account of lost times. A) sensational adj.轰动的B) quixoticC) provincial adj.狭隘的D) impractical adj.不切实际的E) subversive adj.颠覆性的,暗中破坏的F) parochial adj.狭隘的 选AC. temptation n.诱惑后面说很少有人愿意去读过分特例化的东西, 前面对应 狭隘的. 合理! xGSco137Taxonomy has gained a reputation as___science, a reputation that is not mitigated by the incessant changing of the names of organisms and the seemingly haphazard approach taken to the definition of taxa. A) an arcaneB) an arbitraryC) an exactingD) a rigorousE) an obstinateF) a capricious mitigate v.减轻,缓和CD. xGSc0138Technological developments in the nineteenth century took longer to___ than they do today: many of that century’s advances were known to scientists but not to average people. A. occurB. propagateC.accelerateD. multiplyE.spreadF. increase xGSCo139One of the incongruities of modern industry, according to Reck and Graedel, is that we manufacture modern products with the most sophisticated technologies available yet generally adopt relatively___ approaches to recycling them. A. economicalB. basicc. crudeD. conventionalE. inefficientF. inexpensive xGSC0140ln the 1990s, the limited color palette of display screens was___the electronics industry, working through a United Nations agency, adopted a worldwide standard color gamut that all televisions should be able to display.A. codifiedB. encryptedC. enforcedD. expandedE. formalizedF. denounced 单空xGsco001The composer’s music had been criticized for being simple and accessible to a fault, but defenders countered that music need not be____to be great A) innovativeB) capricious adj.反复无常的C) inscrutable adj. 不可理解的D) meritorious adj.值得赞扬的E) bombastic adj.浮夸的 我的答案: C. 音乐没必要是不可理解的才是好的. xGSco002Unlike other rap artists, who often___ behind the microphone, Drake writes out every word of his rhymes before he performs them. A) linger v.存留B) proselytize v.传教C) extemporizeD) fulminate v.愤怒谴责E) compromise 我的答案: C. xGsco003His lackadaisical approach to this project belies his well-known reputation for___ A) flippancy n.轻率B) mordancyc) preciosityD) prodigality n.浪费,慷慨E) assiduity n.勤奋 我的答案: E xGsco004The danger of valuing animals in proportion to their apparent possession of human characteristics is the subject of Budiansky’s new book,an extended critique of___in animal behavior research. A. pragmatismB. humanitarianism n.人道主义C. anthropomorphism n.拟人化D. empiricismE. cynicism n.愤世嫉俗 cynic n.愤世嫉俗者 a person who believes that people only do things to help themselves, rather than for good or sincere reasons 我的答案: B 错了. 正确答案: C xGsc0005Gluten—a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye-was formerly avoided only by those suffering from celiac disease but has recently become a popular dietary____, with gluten-free foods popping up everywhere. A) fadB) substitute n.替代物, 替补 “我去看CBA印象中MC会说substitution”C) panaceaD) scam n.欺诈,骗局E) villain n.反面角色,坏蛋 我的答案: A. 错了, 读题不仔细. 说这种东西g 过去 只有那些有某种病的人避免, 现在___, g-free的食物流行. free是关键, ___处应该填负面的词. xGScoo06ln seventeenth-century science, we witness the first instance of technological___: scientific tools, constructed from existing scientific knowledge, led to the acquisition of new knowledge that in turn contribute to improving the tools’ design. A) breakthroughB) feedbackC) controversyD) cooperationE) malaise 我的答案: B. xGsc0007There is a rather___reason for astronomers’sudden interest in comets: most other bodies in the solar system have been explored already. A. pedanticB. prosaicC. controversialD. untenableE. mysterious 我的答案: B. body 可以表示 天体 comet 彗星 xGsc0008Because we participate in the dynamics of ecosystems as we restore them, restoration practice is in essence antithetical to the idea of a___wilderness. A) managedB) developingC) rehabilitated – rehabilitate v.使恢复D) pristine adj.崭新的,处于原始状态的(未开发的)E) degraded 我的答案: C 错了正确答案: D in antithetical to 对立的因为当我们restore自然的时候, 肯定会产生变化, restore这个动作就和这个idea是对立的, 什么idea, 就是 崭新的自然 这个观点. xGSc0009lt is ironic that the scientist’s work was criticized recently for its___ research methodology, since other researchers have argued for years that this same methodology was based absolutely on impeccable logic. A) fastidious adj.挑剔的,难伺候的B) esotericC) abstruseD) impervious adj.不能渗透的,不受影响的E) specious adj.似是而非的 我的答案: C 错正确答案: E impeccable adj.无错误的；无瑕疵的 xGSCo010Central control of the country’s power grid is difficult because of the___of the electricity industry——it is made up of hundreds of local networks with separate owners. A) bifurcationB) interdependenceC) nationalizationD) tractabilityE) balkanization 我的答案: E. xGSC0011Hotels in major urban markets seem to offer the biggest potential___ make an investment in the lodging sector, those hotels took the hardest hit during the recession, and analysts expect them to bounce back just as steeply.A) risk forB) concession fromC) source ofD) disincentive toE) windfall to 我的答案: E. xGSC0012Given the extraordinary___of its arguments, it is surprising that the central thesis of the book can be stated so simply.A) nuanceB) insensitivityC) lucidityD) spuriousnessE) rationality 我的答案: C. 不认识单词. 正确答案: nuance xGsC0013The Internet is an eternally unfinished monument to___ ,a text that aspires to be as big and multifarious as the world it describes. A) inclusionB) self-promotionC) innovationD) trivialityE) abstraction 我的答案: A. xGSC0014In nineteenth-century Japan, the national government’s template for presenting annual statistical information proved, in practice, to be____: regional statistical yearbooks reveal a subtle reshuffling of the template’s categories to showcase what mattered most to local officials. A. intractableB. malleablec. providentD. inviolableE. practicable 我的答案:D. 正确答案: B. xGSC0015The distance between Tibetan villages is sometimes____ by the number of cups of tea sustain a person traveling that route: three cups of tea are roughly equal to eight kilometers. A) amplifiedB) foreshadowedC) eclipsedD) constrainedE) reckoned v.估计 我的答案: E xGsc0016Archaeopteryx had feathers on its hind limbs that helped stabilize it and acted as air brakes, allowing the otherwise____creature to turn more adeptly and fly steadily.A) docile adj.驯服的,温顺的B) ungainlyC) unpredictableD) torpid adj.无精打采的,有气无力的E) reckless adj.鲁莽的 我的答案:B. adept adj.熟练的 xGsc0017The fiftieth birthday of this much-admired musician has, predictably, given rise to various____including two flattering television documentaries about her life. A) encomiums n.赞美B) diatribesC) controversiesD) exposesE) conundrums 我的答案: D. 正确答案: A. xGSc0018The results of the latest survey being ___, earlier results gave researchers little relevant experience for the new data’s interpretation. A) superfluous adj.多余的B) inconsequentialC) tediousD) unexampledE) familiar 我的答案: D. xGsc0019ln protoscientific times (for example, in ancient Greece), claims about the physical world were often accepted as true if they were reasonable; experimental verification, if thought necessary at all, was___. A. utilitarianB. perfunctoryC. egregiousD. empiricalE. inductive 我的答案: B. xGSC0020In order to put their own ideas to a scrupulous test, scientists should actively try to falsify them, though in practice such attempts at____rarely have the vigor theorists of scientific method would prefer. A. empiricismB. disavowalC. self-refutation n.自我否认D. countermanding countermand v.取消,撤销E. circuitousness circuitous adj.迂回的 我的答案: A. 懵的. 正确答案: C xGSco021In recent years, the country’s farmers have been extremely___, contributing a major portion of the disturbances and protests against government policies. A) discerningB) tractableC) restiveD) mercurial adj.水银的,善变的E) circumspect 我的答案: C. disturbance n.动乱,骚乱 xGsc0022Concerned about the growing tendency of universities to sometimes reward celebrity more generously than specialized expertise, many academics have deplored the search for____ to which that practice leads. A) approbationB) collegialityC) eruditionD) renown n.声望,名望E) prowess n.高超的技能 我的答案: A. 正确答案: D celebrity n.名望,名声 deplore v.强烈谴责 concern about 担忧 xGSC0023The design of many seventeenth-century scientific instruments was not entirely____; in their construction, such instruments already involved many assumptions about aspects of the phenomena that they were aimed to investigate. A) consistentB) originalC) preciseD) impartialE) versatile 我的答案: C. 正确答案: D. 后半句说, 许多仪器已经包含了许多他们想要研究现象的假设. –> 这些仪器并非完全公正的. xGsc0024While Pompeian houses vary in their size, ground plan, and decorative schemes, they do tend to___ certain consistent design motivations: their owners all seem to have aimed toward creating a certain kind of domestic space. A) informB) defyC) inspireD) thwartE) betray 我的答案: E. xGSc0025Historically, it has been unusual for scientific terms, once coined, to enter common usage with much___: “scientist” and “dinosaur” (coined in 1833 and 1842, respectively), for instance, were rarely used before the late nineteenth century. A) recognitionB) dispatchC) accuracyD) controversyE) acclaim 我的答案: B. with dispatch 迅速 xGSc0026lt would be a disservice to the novel’s intricate construction to provide its readers in advance with even___ summation of its unfolding events: the book should be allowed to reveal its own surprises. A) a subjectiveB) a cursoryC) an incisiveD) a comprehensiveE) a predictable 我的答案: C. 正确答案: B. disservice v.帮倒忙,伤害. summation n.总结,概括. 翻译: 哪怕是仅仅给出 对于该书未展开情节的 仓促的 概括 也是 有害的, 这本书应该自己揭露它的惊喜. xGSC0027Robin’s words were not without emotion: they retained their level tone only by a careful___imminent extremes. A) equipoise between 平衡B) embrace ofC) oscillation betweenD) limitation toE) subjection to v.屈服于 我的答案: D.正确答案: A. Robin的话并非没有感情, 他们之所以听起来冷静, 只是因为他们在迫近的极端之间谨慎地保持平衡. xGSc0028The regulatory agency’s attempts to impose new and harsher restrictions on the business community were met with such___that the agency finally opted to maintain its existing rules. A) impunity n.(惩罚的)免除B) probityC) recalcitrance n.反抗 recalcitrance adj.不守规矩的,桀骜不驯的D) indemnity n.赔偿E) approbation 我的答案: A.正确答案: C. 单词题. xGSc0029Few meteorites are ___: most languish for many years before being found, their untold stories slowly fading from extended exposure to wind and rain. A. hazardousB. massiveC. invaluableD. pristineE. prehistoric 我的答案: D. meteorite n.陨石 languish v.长期受苦 xGSc0030The movie has a surfeit of inscrutable characters and tortuous subplots, so it is no surprise that viewers leaving the recent screening appeared____. A. complacentB. phlegmaticC. nonplussed nonplus v.使迷惑,使混乱D. unsated adj.不满足的E. beguiled beguile v.哄骗,诱骗;吸引 我的答案: E.正确答案: D. tortuous adj.冗长费解的,拐弯抹角的 xGsc0031The____ of the Internet has a price: because the Internet was designed to suit a wide variety of applications, the service it delivers is almost certainly not optimal for any particular application. A. immediacyB. generalityc. complexityD. ubiquityE. interactivity 我的答案: B. xGSc0032Age data from meteorites suggests that, in contrast to the relatively ___pace of planetary evolution we are witnessing today, the first ten million years or so of our solar system history were extremely eventful. A) structuredB) uncertainC) pedestrianD) productiveE) menacing – menace n.v.威胁 我的答案: C. eventful adj.充满大事的, 多姿多彩的. xGSco033Thanks to their importance as components in the catalytic converters that reduce vehicle emissions,platinum, palladium, and rhodium have all become____in the fight against air pollution. A) paradigmsB) aberrations n.异常C) noveltiesD) bulwarks n.保障E) exceptions 我的答案: A.正确答案: D. xGsc0034While the theory that volcanic activity enables the venting of methane gas from subsurface reserves offers a reasonable explanation for the replenishing of methane in Titan’s atmosphere, volcano-like structures on Titan’s surface are___. A) relatively typicalB) slowly evolvingC) truly fascinatingD) geologically activeE) still undiscovered 我的答案: D.正确答案: E. 我的逻辑错了. 前面是让步, 后面应该取反. xGsc0035Despite having been designated as an interdepartmental effort, the project involved no real___of viewpoints.A) distillation n.蒸馏物,精华B) synthesisC) explicationD) dilution n.稀释,冲淡E) encapsulation – encapsulate v.概括 我的答案: B. xcSco036Because the weight of melting ice sheets and glaciers is increasing pressure on the Earth’s ocean floors,causing them to sink, measurements of sea-level rise have probably ____ the increasing volume of water in the oceans. A) anticipatedB) includedC) exaggeratedD) underestimatedE) pinpointed 我的答案: D. xGSc0037To write convincing fiction about the tedium of ordinary life may be one of the hardest challenges facing a novelist, who must find a way to engage the reader despite a focus on___events. A) distressing adj.令人痛苦的 — distress n.忧虑；悲伤；痛苦B) dubiousC) quotidian adj.日常的D) unwonted adj.不平常的；异常的E) nebulous adj.模糊的 我的答案: C. xGsc0038The myth of the scientific method as a neat progression from hypothesis to experiment to conclusion is dispelled once you enter a lab and observe the____ process by which researchers actually make discoveries. A) meticulousB) unproductiveC) imperturbableD) haphazardE) sequential 我的答案: D. dispel v.消除 认识dispel是解题关键. 认为科学史顺序过程的观念会被消除, 当你进入实验室 观察随机的过程, 科学家们就是从这些随机的过程中有所发现的. xGSco039Before divulging the nature of their experiments, the researchers anticipated___, thinking that their work might appear macabre; hence they prepared carefully for a press conference at which they emphasized the project’s scientific and medical value. A. trifling criticism 细微的批评B. adverse repercussions 不良影响C. indecipherable outcomes 难以辨认的的结果D. widespread indifferenceE. spontaneous approval 我的答案: E.正确答案: B. divulge v.泄露 macabre adj.可怕的 xGSCo040Woody plant responses to herbivory were always thought to be____; however, some scientists have reported localized responses to herbivory in certain woody plants. A. timelyB. marginalC. unpredictableD. adequateE. systemic 我的答案: C.正确答案: E localized adj.局部的,地区的 systemic adj.系统的

title: GRE作文
content: 方法论观点对错 和 政策后果 都是分情况讨论.观点我们就看他在什么情况下对, 什么情况下不对, 对的情况下多我们就支持, 反之我们就反对.政策后果我们就看他有哪些好的影响, 有哪些坏的影响, 好的影响多我们就支持, 反之我们就反对. claim 和 reason 其实就是 一个该不该 + 一个是不是 (总之可以看成两个独立的issue). 带让步的反对就是反对一个, 支持另一个.比如一个题目: 所有决定都应该交给政治家和政府官员. 原因是: 他们具有更多信息. 所以相比于普罗大众, 可以做出更准确更好的判断.观点: 支持事实:官员就是比老百姓的信息更多. 但是并不是所有的政治家都会使用这些信息用于做出对社会有利的决定. 所以并不是所有决定都应该交给政治家来做. 敌方观点: 就是说, 不仅要使劲说自己的观点好, 还要留一手, 写敌方观点怎么反驳. 比较下面两个论证: 1.困为飞沫传播是新冠肺炎传播的重要途径，所以我们在任何时候都要戴口罩. 2.诚然吃饭、独处或者在人烟稀少的户外可以不戴口罩，但因为飞沫传播是新冠肺炎传播的重要途径，所以我们在大部分时候还是要戴口罩 承认敌方观点的合理性, 坚持己方观点的优越性—让步. 极端词. – 去掉 极端词的观点支持, 但是 加上极端词的观点, 反对. — 让步. 1题目As people rely more and more on technology to solve problems, the ability of humans to think for themselves will surely deteriorate. Write a response in which you discuss the extent to which you agree or disagree with the statement and explain your reasoning for the position you take. In developing and supporting your position, you should consider ways in which the statement might or might not hold true and explain how these considerations shape your position. 题目说: 人们越来越依赖科技解决问题, 人类独立思考的能力肯定会受到损害. 我现在要来驳斥它. 作文To defy the remorseless conditions of the natural world, each species must have a means of ensuring survival. These means exist in a remarkable range of forms such as agility, defensive structures,or,in humanity’s case,mental acuity. For mankind, survival has always depended on the ability to solve problems. And one problem solving tool that has benefited mankind since its inception is the invention of technology. The record of human history has demonstrated that humanity has relied increasingly on technology while showing no deterioration of mental facility. Therefore, the statement that the ability of humans to think for themselves will be hindered by increased reliance on technology is fallacious,because it is indisputable that mankind has for the duration of its existence relied more and more on technology to solve problems while at the same time the ability of humans to think for themselves has increased or at the very least remained at the same level. 第一段亮明了观点. 说每种动物都要练就生存的能力, 人也不例外, 人的能力就是解决问题. 其中一种解决问题的手段就是科技. 人类的历史证明了, 科技不断进步, 然而智力水平并没有下降. 所以, 题目中提出的观点是错误的. 观点是谬误的: The statement is fallacious. The record of human history has demonstrated that… 人类的历史证明了… it is indisputable that 不容置疑的是 mankind has relied more and more on technology to solve problems. In the dawn of humanity, when mankind shed the prominent incisors, thick fur and powerful musculature of its evolutionary ancestors, the acquisition of another means of survival was imperative. From the very beginning, humans have consistently relied on the development of technology to solve problems. For example, as it radiated outward from its African cradle, early Man came up against increasingly cooler climates.At some point, these early humans must have hit a wall, a climatic limit on spatial expansion that required problem solving to counter. The answer to this problem was, of course, the development of new technologies. Tools were developed to fell trees and fashion simple yet protective dwellings;clothing was made of animal furs and hides to retain warmth. Fire was harnessed to provide heat as well as increased nourishment through the cooking of food. 在人类诞生之初，当人类摆脱了其进化祖先的突出的门牙、厚厚的皮毛和强大的肌肉组织时，获得另一种生存手段势在必行。从一开始，人类就一直依靠技术的发展来解决问题。例如，当人类从非洲的摇篮向外辐射时，早期人类遇到了越来越冷的气候。在某种程度上，这些早期人类一定是撞上了一堵墙，这是一种气候对空间扩张的限制，需要解决问题来应对。这个问题的答案当然是新技术的发展。人们发明了工具来砍伐树木，建造简单但有保护作用的住所;衣服是用动物皮毛和兽皮制成的，以保持温暖。火被用来提供热量，并通过烹饪食物来增加营养。 And so it was that, to continue the aforementioned metaphor,mankind succeeded in taking its firstbaby steps. Yet the solution of one set of problems often presents humanity with a new, increasingly com-plex set of problems. Those who ascribe to the statement above would expect humans to have a decreasedability to think for themselves after using technology to solve the first set of problems,however, this isnot the case. To illustrate this point,consider the invention of agriculture. Farming allowed increasedpopulation and the development of cities. With cities came a host of economical, medical, and philosophi-cal problems that dwarfed the formerly existing problems in complexity. Nevertheless,with each new setof problems and the use of new technologies to solve them, humans have thus far been able to solve manyresultant problems even if they are more complex than the original.Therefore, the statement above is rather short-sighted because it relies heavily on popular miscon-ceptions without considering the record of increased use of technology in human history. Contrary to the 2题目To understand the most important characteristics of a society, one must study its major cities. 作文The world today has witnessed an ever-increasing pace of urbanization.Such a fast pace has led some people to believe that one has to study the major cities in order to fully understand the society’s most important characteristics. The globalization has brought people of different countries much closer than ever before. In this process, people encountered new cultures and communities, prompting the question how we could best understand the most important characteristics of a society.The world today has been witnessing an ever-increasing pace of urbanization, leading some people to believe that one has to study the major cities in order to fully understand the society’s most important characteristics.From my point of view, it is admittedly true that from those giant cities we can learn a lot about a culture. However, the most important characteristics of a society might not be observed in the cities, but rather must sometimes be sought in the countryside. 让步段First of all, some people argue that the most important characteristics of a society can only be found in major cities, which I can partially agree. The reason is manifold. One important aspect is that the capital of a nation is almost always located in major cities, such as Beijing, Tokyo, and Washington D.C.Another reason is that the major cities are most likely the hubs of economic activities and most people lives.For example, to understand the rapid economic development of China since the “Reform and opening up” policy, the best way is to look at the futuristic skylines of major cities like Shenzhen and Shanghai.This example shows the power of major cities in terms of showing the key characteristics of a society. 反对段That being said, I do not believe that all of the most important characteristics of a society can be found in major cities, for the reason that many culture elements of those societies come from countryside. not the major cities.The reason is quite self-evident: the majority of global population has been living in the countryside long before urbanization took off in the recent decades.Take the United States for example. One of the defining features of American culture is her obsession with firearms, which has even been codified by the Second Amendment. Yet, if one studies the American cities, most of which are strongly for strict gun controls, he or she cannot grasp this crucial aspect of the American society.As a consequence, only studying the major cities may not fully reveal the most important characteristics of a society, which should in turn be sought in the countryside. To summarize, while I do agree to some extent that a megacity has a lot to offer for anyone interested in understanding the society, cities do not always hold the key to those most important characteristics of a society. Such characteristics must be found elsewhere. 3题目作文With the development of economy move the wheel of the history forward, an increasingly amount of people believe that we should make as much money as we can to chase our personal success. Therefore, someone notes that educational institutions are supposed to dissuade students from fields in which they are less likely to achieve success. However, in my point of view, as it is so difficult to give the word “success” an explicit definition, educational institutions should respect students’ own decisions on pursuing fields of study, rather than prevent them from entering fields they are interested in even if those fields have a less chance of success.

title: 移动互联网开发class2
path: /2024/03/04/[大三下]移动互联网技术及应用/
content: 期末作业 做作业1, 开发一个APP 就叫NBA知识大全. – 你还在为女朋友不懂篮球而苦恼吗? 你还在被兄弟喷不懂球吗? 现在下载NBA知识大全, 成为模仿背单词APP的形式, 出一个图片 + 一段文字, 下面四个选项, 判断正误.后面高级功能可以是得分排行榜.可以选择题目集. 第二章GSM全球移动通信系统Global System for Mobile communications, 主要服务陆地, 是第二代移动通信系统2G. GSM的网络结构 移动台 MS 简单理解类似手机一样的东西，包括移动台物理设备(ME)和智慧部件SIM卡两部分，类型有车载台、便携台以及手持台等。 移动终端ME 话音加密 信道编码 信息加密 信息的调制和解调 信息发射和接收 客户识别卡 SIM 存储了用户的各种信息, 包括国际移动用户识别码IMSI号, PIN码等, 它与网络数据库中存储的信息一致 无线基站子系统 BSS Base Station Subsystem由MSC控制, 与MS进行通信的系统设备. 主要完成无线发送, 接收和无线资源管理.BSC: 基站控制器. BTS:基站收发信机. 网络交换子系统 NSS Network service subsystem 操作维护子系统 OMC 移动终端MEE 是 equipment话音编码/信源编码(64k b/s), 信道编码, 信息加密, 信息的调制和解调, 信息发射和接受 位置区信息 不能太小也不能太大 GGSN 接入公网的锚点.锚点不变, 就意味着ip是不变的. GPRS / 3G4G5GNB-IoT

title: GRE填空13
content: 单空 & 双空section 1111.Unable to escape their own literary tradition, literary critics either become the____ of that tradition or, on the contrary, use their knowledge of it to reinterpret writers and trends from new perspectives. A. liberators B. guardians C. successors D.antithesis E.gadflies 选B.跟我分析的一致: 中间说正相反, 后面说另一派人是 重新解释, 然后形成新的观点, 前面的一派人自然是 旧的, 那b选项, 保卫者 合理. gadfly n.牛虻；讨厌的人 2.Not only was Jarry___ the pandemonium his play sparkled, he actually worked to foment the conflict,organizing a posse to boo if the rest of the audience applauded and cheer if the other attendees booed. A. riled byB. surprised byC. unperturbed byD. critical ofE. detached from pandemonium n.骚动；群情沸腾 foment vt. 煽动；挑起 boo v.发嘘声，喝倒彩 perturb v.使…焦虑 unperturbed adj.镇静的, 没有被干扰的 rile v.惹恼；激怒 detach v.拆卸；（使）分开，脱离 3.Boreal forest is at the southern boundary of the moss-dominated tundra,which remainscharacteristically treeless because its spongy surface retains water that cannot drain away through the underlying permafrost. But as temperatures rise the permafrost recedes, (i)___the(ii)___of forest.A. impairingB. facilitatingC.deceleratingD. renewalE. incursionF. decline 分析: 选择BE. incursion 翻译成 进入,入侵. 前面说树少, 因为permafrost 冻土, 现在气温升高, 冻土 recede 减退, 就说明树 多了, 于是选 促进了树木的进入. 4.As late as the 1990s,Merry Wiesner Hanks argued that developments during the Reformation and the Enlightenment had (i)_____effects on the participation of women in the filed of medicine. She claimed that the (ii)___Reformation and Enlightenment women left female health’s practitioners restricted to assisting in an unpaid and unrecognized capacity. A.dire adj.极其严重的,极糟的,极差的B. positiveC.ambiguous D. unchanging opportunities forE. worsening positions ofF. reader respect for the Reformation and the Enlightenment 文艺复兴和启蒙运动分析: 后面说的是 unpaid unrecognized 都是负面的词, 说明那个时期女性地位不高, 所以选择AE. section 1101.Characteristic of the diplomat’s new book is the____relationship between the evidence adduced and the inferences drawn, the footnotes and citations teeming with ambiguity and complexity, while the summary statements are more dogmatic simplicities. A. healthyB. shiftingC. tenuousD.compellingE.plausible 首先 compelling 是 有说服力的, 而不是 矛盾的分析句子: 后面的评价主要是 负面的, 又模糊, 又复杂, 又教条主义, 前面应该选一个比较负面的 tenuous 脆弱的 符合题意.draw 这里取 draw a conclusion 的意思, 得出结论. 同样也可以得出 推断. 2.Notwithstanding a lack of____, nineteenth-century anthologies such as Evert and George Duyckinck’s Cyclopaedia of American Literature represents serious attempts to collect the national writings up to that point as a way of establishing the viability of American letters. A. biasB.earnestnessC. rigor n.严格D.ambitionE.ambiguity n.摸棱两可 earnest adj.认真的,真挚的 Evert and George Duyckinck’s Cyclopaedia of American Literature 这整个是一本书.notwithstanding 虽然, 这个挺重要的一个转折词.后面说 这本书 代表了 严肃的尝试 取收集 国产的写作作品, 到了一个程度: 确立美国信件的可行性. In his study of Senegambian cleric Shaykh Mass Kah (1827-1936), Bala S. K. Saho notes that it is difficult to fully (i)___ many of the oral accounts on which the study relies. Saho’s work shows.however, that despite this absence of (ii)___, oral history can provide useful sources from which historians can reconstruct the past.
