A. comprehendB. reproduceC.validate D. partialityE. argumentationF.corroboration CF. For a genre that’s supposed to be about the future, science fiction has certainly (i)___lately,(ii)___is what sells best, with readers spending their money on sequels to long-running series. A. become quite pessimisticB. been looking backwardC. anticipated technological developments D.suspenseE. fantasyF. nostalgia 选BF. 因为前面说 对于一个本该关注未来的体裁来说, 科幻小说最近怎么样怎么样, 那肯定是取反, 选关注过去, 自然第二个空也出来了. section 1091.Because of its___DNA can be invaluable as exculpatory evidence following a criminal conviction: it can be reliably tested years after a crime has occurred. A. versatilityB. recognizabilityC. durabilityD. verifiabilityE. distinctiveness 选C. 后面 years, 基本不太用认识太多单词. 简单题. invaluable adj.无价之宝的 2.Throughout the High Middle Ages, the English government became increasingly_____: the document produced in the eleventh century could be placed on one large table, while the documents produced in the thirteenth fill whole rooms. A. despoticB. ceremonialC. aristocraticD. prolixE. insular 选D. prolix adj.罗嗦的, 冗长的. 也算是蒙对了, 刚开始放一桌子, 后来放一个房间, 说明政府越来越 啰嗦. despotic adj. 暴虐的，暴君的；专横的 aristocratic adj. 贵族的 aristocrat n.贵族 Although strikes remain rarer in Britain than in many other European countries, and their economic impact is(i)__compared to the great upheavals of the 1970s and 1980s, their number has(ii)__after a few years of somewhat greater calm.A. inconclusiveB. demoralizingC. negligible D.explodedE. declinedF. revived 选CF. revive v.复兴,复苏 Many of us remember a time when discovery and the thrill of learning were forces in our lives and were(i)__Frequently that time happened in a great classroom somewhere, in the hands of the one (ii)__teacher we can each remember.A. elusiveB.inconsequentialC.exciting D.consummate adj.完美的,圆满的 v.圆房E. truculent adj.好斗的F. superfluous adj.多余的,过剩的 选CD. 单词题. Because it is discussed by humanities scholars from diverse disciplinary backgrounds, “affect” has been (i)___defined; nonetheless there has been (ii)___the terms “emotion” and “affect’across academic writing in the humanities.A. clearlyB. variouslyC. narrowly D. a paucity of interest inE.a variety of interpretations ofF.a consistent distinction between 选BF. 选对了, 前面说多元化, 后面说一致性. section 1071.Once so fluid, the political situation had, two years after the declaration of the Republic,____so much that further change seemed inconceivable. A. revitalizedB. warmedC. intensifiedD. clottedE. destabilized conceive v.想象 inconceivable adj.不可思议的 clot v.凝结 destabilize v.使不稳定 句子分析: Once so fluid 修饰 政治局势, 后面有一个时间状语不用管, 再后面才是 谓语, 政治局势变得怎么样了, 前面是fluid流动, 后面说进一步的变化变得难以想象, 说明当前的政治局势变得 clot 凝结. 2.Paul Robeson.Jr. wrote that his father was a flesh-and-blood artist whose accomplishments made him susceptible to hagiographic treatment by potential biographers. Robeson achievements were real, and there was no need for____. A. disclosureB. hyperboleC. retractionD. muckrakingE. reticence 选 B. 选对了. 夸大. hagiographic 理想化的, 偶像化的 flesh-and-blood 有血有肉的 disclosure n.揭露 reticent adj.缄默的 muckraking n.揭发丑闻muck,粪肥，raking,耙子，耙地。讽刺用法，最早来自美国总统罗斯福在1906 年的一次演讲 讽刺记者，后来被记者们用以自嘲并欣然接受该称呼。 The scientists who first proposed that Moon’s craters had resulted from impacts (i)__almost all of these craters were circular, and yet most impactors in heliocentric orbit would have an oblique path and hence would be expected to form (ii)___craters. A. devised a theoryB. misinterpreted a findingC. confronted difficultyD. massiveE. elongatedF. shallow crater n.火山口,坑 elongated adj.拉长了的,细长的 oblique adj.斜的 confront v.面对, 面临 devise v.设计,发明 选CE. 前面说所有坑都是圆形的, 后面说倾斜的轨道, 选项中又出现了 elongated 说明按照理论, 坑应该是长条形的, 前一个空自然选出 科学家们正在 面临一个难题. When the United States government created the Post Office at the founding of the republic, it didn’t invite rival postal firms to compete; in fact, it created a monopoly. That monopoly, however, was (i)___free expression because of policies Congress adopted, which (ii)___the circulation of newspapers irrespective of their viewpoint and spread postal service throughout the country. A. conducive toB. threatened byC. dependent on D. subsidizedE. limitedF. trivialized congress n.国会 conductive adj.有益的,有帮助的 circulation n.发行量 irrespective adj.不考虑,不顾 subsidize v.资助；补助；给…发津贴 单词题. 选AD. 前面说 垄断 反而 因为国会采纳的政策而 帮助了 自由言论. 后面说 国会具体是通过 资助报纸发行量(无论观点如何) 来帮助的. 6 选 2section 107Nature-loving pilgrims from the eastern United States altered the country’s attitude toward California’s sequoia groves, transforming those stands of great trees from scientific curiosities to places of___. A. recreationB. mysteryC. venerationD. solitudeE. reverenceF. acclamation pilgrim n.朝圣者 把那些大树 从 科学的好奇, 转变为 受人尊敬的地方. venerate v.尊敬 reverence n.尊敬, 崇敬 Established scientists recognize that peer review of manuscripts submitted to scientific journalsis critical to science, but this recognition ____ a certain ambivalence in them, since reviewing takes time away from their research.A.obviatesB.mitigatesC.engendersD.tempersE.inducesF.exacerbates 选CE 引起,产生. ambivalence n.矛盾情绪；正反感情并存 obviate v.消除；排除 9.Despite____ leaving their old jobs behind, workers were eager to move because there were to be no layoffs under the union contract at the new location.A. jubilation overB. indifference toC. misgivings aboutD. outrage overE. trepidation overF. enthusiasm for layoff n.解雇，下岗； trepidation n.担忧,焦虑,惊惶不安 misgiving n.疑虑, 担忧 outrage n. 愤慨，愤怒；v. 使愤怒，激怒 jubilation n.欢欣鼓舞,欢庆 After the Turkish Republic was established, traditional hamams (bathhouses) seemed to manyTurks to be outmoded, but thanks to tourism, hamams have experienced a___.becoming important cultural sites for foreign and Turkish visitors alike. A. proliferationB.retrenchmentC.transformationD.revivalE.slumpF.renaissance slump v.（价格、价值、数量等）骤降，猛跌；惨败，猛跌选 DF. 复兴, 能分析出来. section 1097.Precipitation is not___in the Atacama Desert west of Andes mountains, and water scarcity is compounded by problems with water appropriation, the existence of agro pastoralists is in jeopardy. A. regularB.negligibleC.evidentD.consistentE.insignificantF.abundant precipitation n.降水 in jeopardy 处于危险境地；受到威胁 pastoralist n.牧场主 选AF. 降水本来就不 丰富, 又伴随着水资源的挪用, 牧场主的生存受到威胁. What differentiates this book from more traditional works on grammar is that it reserves its ___ not for students of writing, but for teachers who harbor unduly restrictive views. A. mockeryB.skepticismC.scoldingD.approbationE.admonishmentF.commendation harbor n.港湾 v.庇护 unduly adv.过度地 admonish v.责备；告诫； 这本书与传统语法书不同的地方在于, 它不是对学生的写作保留了批评, 而是对庇护过度限制语法(死板)的老师保留了批评. Like ants’ propensity to congregate on one food pile and neglect another, the human tendency to make choices that___ the observed behavior of others is a self-reinforcing process A.imitateB.confirmC.avoidD.emulateE. inhibitF.constrain 选AD. 模仿. The difficulty bf reforming electoral politics is not lack of right tools but the need to put them into the hands of impartial agents: the goal should be to build capacity while___ partisanship. A. expeditingB.constrainingC.facilitatingD.deterringE.exacerbatingF.lamenting lament v.对…感到悲痛；痛惜；对…表示失望 partisanship n.盲目支持, 党派偏见 expedite v.加快；加速 deter v.威慑, 阻止, 使不敢 增大能力的同时 还要 限制,制止阻止 党派偏见. section 110When it comes to arriving at brilliant ideas, filtering out distractions might well be____:if a person’s mind is wandering, that person tends to outperform peers in a range of tasks in which flashes of insight are important. A.indispensable adj.不可或缺的B.irrelevantC.overrated – overrate v.高估D.imperative adj.极其重要的E.deleteriousF.counterproductive 事与愿违的 选 EF. 后面的意思是说, 思绪在游走的时候, 更容易产生绝妙的想法. 所以前面说, 过滤掉干扰选项 是 有害的, 事与愿违的. 8.Matsui is an extremely ____ political tactician, as she generally will withhold her support for a faction or a policy until she is confident it will prevail.A.successfulB.dogmaticC.shrewdD.flexibleE.cannyF. rigid adj.过于严格的, 死板的, 僵硬的 选CE. 简单题. There is ample evidence that men and women think, express themselves, and even experience emotions differently, but in the area of sensory perception, psychologists are hard-pressed to identify major____. A. difficultiesB. innovationsC. discrepancies – discrepancy n.差异D. challengesE. incongruitiesF. trends 选CE. 简单题. 但是这题告诉我, 要能从单词的变形中辨认出原本的单词. 10.Robbins’accomplishment is not___one:her book makes the topic accessible to a general audience while still providing the sort of analysis that scholars demand.A. a trivialB. a fascinatingC. a questionableD. an insignificantE. an intriguing – intrigue v.激起…的兴趣；引发…的好奇心F. an amusing 选AD. 简单题. section 111We should be more ___ than we often are when making claims about antiquity-for example, the common statement, “The ancient Athenians invented democracy,” is simply not true when put like that. A. skepticalB. credulousC. preciseD. trustingE. equivocalF. circumspect democracy n. 民主政体；民主国家；民主，民主精神 credulous adj.轻信的 circumspect adj. 小心谨慎的，考虑周到的，慎重的 选 CF. 注意 circumscribe vt. 约束，限定；在……上画圈；包围；（几何学）外接 和 circumspect 不太一样 The author advocates a diminished role for philosophy, aiming to show that many of the questions traditionally debated among philosophers can be ___ the realm of scientific inquiry.A. ceded toB.inferred fromC.relevant toD.initiated byE.germane toF. left to 选 AF. 说的是, 很多哲学家讨论的话题实际上 可以 让与 科学的范畴. With regard to verity, neutrality, and transparency, nothing about the Internet makes it any different than Gutenberg’s printing press, which could serve___just as well as truth.A. fantasyB. bureaucracy n.官僚制度C. protocolD.disinformation n.虚假信息E.mendacity n.谎言F. panic 解析：这个题只能根据just as well as truth来选，题目说也可以是事实，那么空格应该选事实的反义词，所以答案选DE选项。disinformation谎言，mendacity谎言。 翻译：关于真理，中立和透明，互联网的任何东西都和古腾堡的印刷机没啥大的区别，可能是谎言也可能是事实 As astronomers do not yet have a good understanding of the fundamental nature of dark matter, it should not be a surprise that astronomy students’ ideas about dark matter are, at best, ____. A. superficialB. sketchyC. inconsistentD. mistakenE. outdatedF. far-fetched adj. very difficult to believe 难以置信的；牵强的 AB. 简单题. section 112 Given that the department director was such a feeble contributor, sitting silently at important policy meetings and usually deferring to low-level aides, it was surprising that he had such are reputation for___.A. magnanimityB. perspicacityC. impartialityD. detachmentE. benevolenceF. discernment defer to 听从，遵从 detachment n.超然；超脱；冷漠选BF. 有洞察力的 The book captures the___of several politicians who spoke publicly of old-time virtues in order to mask private vices.A. probityB. dissemblance – dissemble v.掩盖，掩饰C. opportunismD. rectitude – n.正直；诚实 – rectangle n.长方形E. ingenuousness – ingenuous adj.单纯的；天真的F. duplicity n.奸诈 vice n.罪行,邪恶 单词题, 选BF. Upon realizing that the indicators of a stressful situation can be extremely___，the psychologist reconsidered her claim that a reliable way of reducing stress is to recognize stressful situations and then avoid them. A. acuteB. exiguousC. persistentD. overstatedE. tenuousF. unrelenting adj.持续的；不缓和的；势头不减的;不留情的 relent – v. to finally agree to sth after refusing 终于答应；不再拒绝 to become less determined, strong, etc.变缓和；变温和；减弱 解析：这个题是典型的结果推原因，关键词定位到reconsider，心理学家重新考虑她的言论，说明以前的言论有问题存在，再看看言论的内容“一个减压的可靠方式是识别出压力场景然后避免它们”，这个言论的问题就是这种压力场景无法识别，所以答案选BE选项。exiguous太少的，tenuous贫乏的。 翻译：在意识到压力场景的指示物可能是极其稀少之后，心理学家重新考虑了她的言论，言论的内容是“一个减压的可靠方式是识别出压力场景然后避免它们”。 For wily political press officers, the art of spin is not quite supplanting truth with lies, but instead it aspires to replace awkward complexity with catchy___:successful spin creates the impression of unavoidable common sense. A. noveltiesB. slogansC. falsehoods n.虚假,说谎D. duplicityE. simplicityF. intelligibility spin v.n.（尤指有利于自己的）导向性陈述 – 算是熟词生意 虽然没看懂句子, 但是能看出来前后取反. 解析：句子最后提到成功的粉饰能够创造常识，既然是常识，所以特征就是大家都知道，所以答案选EF选项。simplicity简单化，intelligibility容易理解。 翻译：对于狡猾的政治出版社的官员来说，粉饰的艺术不会用谎言替代真相。相反它有志于用引人注意的可理解性来替代尴尬的复杂。成功的粉饰创造了不可避免的常识的印象。

title: 周四小记
content: 明天的会议Zoom Link: https://nus-sg.zoom.us/j/89808231634?pwd=a09RZVR3UVM3SVJPbGQ1M1BHMnBYQT09Meeting ID: 898 0823 1634Password: 912903 时间线第一学期: 117天 遇到一个常见词: eligible 有资格的；合格的；具备条件的 周五 晚上 21:35懒得新开了一个问了一下刘巍老师, 客观讲, 没多少客观数据哈哈.去年一共14个, bupt去了4个, 3 + 1 + 1的模式下, 又不用提前联系老师, 大二去的人不算多, 其实也不少了: 杜哥, 邓思阳, 原, 于哥, 侯老师, 还有一个我认识但是叫不上名字的兄弟 ….总之仔细填一下吧, 今天先做一波题, 然后填一下.

title: 论坛项目实战01
content: 异步请求什么是异步请求? 异步请求就是浏览器没有刷新,但是悄悄访问了一次数据库.联想注册时场景,我输入一个昵称,如果昵称重复,浏览器在不刷新页面的情况下立刻显示”当前昵称已经被占用” springboot 常用注解参见这篇博客: http://t.csdnimg.cn/9qB4K @SpringBootApplication包含@Configuration、@EnableAutoConfiguration、@ComponentScan通常用在主类上； 相关注解 说明 @ComponentScan 用来自动扫描被这些注解标识的类，最终生成ioc容器里的bean，默认扫描范围是@ComponentScan注解所在配置类包及子包的类 @SpringBootConfiguration 与@Configuration作用相同，都是用来声明当前类是一个配置类,这里表明是springboot主类使用的配置类 @EnableAutoConfiguration 是springboot实现自动化配置的核心注解，通过这个注解把spring应用所需的bean注入容器中 @Component 系@Component、@Service、@Controller、@Repository 这几个注解放在一起是因为功能基本一样的，都是将类注入到spring容器中，只不过它们使用的场景不同. 被@Component,@Service,@Controller,@Repository注解标注的类，这些类会被纳入进spring容器中管理。 注解 说明 @Repository 持久层（dao）注入spring容器 @Service 业务逻辑层（server）注入spring容器 @Controller 控制层（controller）注入spring容器 @Component 普通pojo注入spring容器 @ResponseBody@ResponseBody可以作用在方法上或类上，表示该方法的返回结果直接写入 HTTP response body 中，而不会被解析为跳转路径，即不会经过视图解析器，返回什么数据即在页面输入什么数据。 注解 说明 @ResponseBody @ResponseBody的作用其实是将java对象转为json格式的数据。 @RestController该注解是@Controller和@ResponseBody的结合体，一般用于类，作用等于在类上面添加了@ResponseBody和@Controller @AutoWired@AutoWired、@Qualifier、@Resource 这3个注解都是基于注解方式进行自动装配，在容器里面将查找到的bean返回，一般@AutoWired用得最多，@Qualifier则需要配合@AutoWired使用，@Resource则是可以通过名字进行自动装配 注解 说明 @AutoWired @Autowired默认按类型装配，如果发现找到多个bean，则按照name方式比对，如果还有多个，则报出异常 @Qualifier spring的注解，按名字注入 一般当出现两个及以上bean时,不知道要注入哪个，结合@AutoWired使用 @Resource 默认按名称注入例如@Resource(name = “zhaozhao”)则根据name属性注入,找不到则报错，若无name属性则根据属性名称注入，如果匹配不成功则按照类型匹配匹配不成功则报错。 @Qualifier 当有一个接口的多个实现类时，只用@AutoWired会报错，因为它有多个接口的实现类，不知道你要找哪一个，这个时候就需要在注入bean的时候起个名字，然后用@Qualifier注解指定哪一个bean(按照名字注入与装配) @Resource 相当于@Qualifier 和 @AutoWired 同时使用. @RequestMapping、@GetMapping、@PostMapping这3个注解功能也是类似的，通过这3个注解来映射请求，也就是通过它来指定控制器可以处理哪些URL请求，用在方法上，可以通过配置的url进行访问 注解 说明 @RequestMapping @RequestMapping（url），通过该注解就可以通过配置的url进行访问，方式可以是get或post请求，两种方式均可 @GetMapping @GetMapping（url） ，功能类似的，只是这个限定了只能是Get请求 @PostMapping @PostMapping（url），功能类似的，只是这个限定了只能是Post请求 @RequestParam等这几个注解放在一起主要是经常在控制层用来接收参数的 注解 说明 @RequestParam 获取查询参数。即url?name=这种形式 @PathVariable 获取路径参数。即url/{id}这种形式。 @RequestBody 获取Body的参数，一般用于post获取参数 @RequestHeader 获取请求头的信息 @CookieValue 获取Cookie的信息 lombok@Data 该注解相当于同时加上以下注解@Setter @Getter,@ToString,@EqualsAndHashCode MyBatis参考CSDN博客:http://t.csdnimg.cn/l891W参考知乎: https://zhuanlan.zhihu.com/p/260090982 概述mybatis是什么？有什么特点？ 它是一款半自动的ORM持久层框架，具有较高的SQL灵活性，支持高级映射(一对一，一对多)，动态SQL，延迟加载和缓存等特性，但它的数据库无关性较低 什么是ORM？ ObjectRelation Mapping，对象关系映射。对象指的是Java对象，关系指的是数据库中的关系模型，对象关系映射，指的就是在Java对象和数据库的关系模型之间建立一种对应关系，比如用一个Java的Student类，去对应数据库中的一张student表，类中的属性和表中的列一一对应。Student类就对应student表，一个Student对象就对应student表中的一行数据 为什么mybatis是半自动的ORM框架？ 用mybatis进行开发，需要手动编写SQL语句。而全自动的ORM框架，如hibernate，则不需要编写SQL语句。用hibernate开发，只需要定义好ORM映射关系，就可以直接进行CRUD操作了。由于mybatis需要手写SQL语句，所以它有较高的灵活性，可以根据需要，自由地对SQL进行定制，也因为要手写SQL，当要切换数据库时，SQL语句可能就要重写，因为不同的数据库有不同的方言(Dialect)，所以mybatis的数据库无关性低。虽然mybatis需要手写SQL，但相比JDBC，它提供了输入映射和输出映射，可以很方便地进行SQL参数设置，以及结果集封装。并且还提供了关联查询和动态SQL等功能，极大地提升了开发的效率。并且它的学习成本也比hibernate低很多 @Mapper参考博客: https://www.cnblogs.com/jiangzhaowei/p/9879040.html 注册功能注册无非是往数据库User表中添加一条数据.Service层要对逻辑做相应处理, 比如, 对用户输入的密码进行MD5加密, 并且生成随机字符串拼接到密码后. 比如判空逻辑. 比如注册完成之后要发邮件给用户. 利用模板引擎动态生成邮件内容, 主要是那个含激活码和用户Id的链接. 123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536373839404142434445464748public Map<String, Object> register(User user){ Map<String, Object> map = new HashMap<>(); if(user == null){ throw new IllegalArgumentException("参数不能为空"); } if(StringUtils.isBlank(user.getUsername())){ map.put("NameMsg","User name cannot be null"); return map; } if(StringUtils.isBlank(user.getPassword())){ map.put("PasswordMsg","Password cannot be null"); return map; } if(StringUtils.isBlank(user.getEmail())){ map.put("EmailMsg","Email cannot be null"); } User u = userMapper.selectByName(user.getUsername()); if(u != null){ map.put("NameMsg","This name has already been registered."); return map; } u = userMapper.selectByEmail(user.getEmail()); if(u != null){ map.put("EmailMsg","This email has been used. Try another one."); return map; } user.setSalt(CommunityUtil.generateUUID().substring(0,5)); user.setPassword(CommunityUtil.md5(user.getPassword()) + user.getSalt()); user.setType(0); user.setStatus(0); user.setActivationCode(CommunityUtil.generateUUID()); user.setHeaderUrl(String.format("http://images.nowcoder.com/head/%dt.png", new Random().nextInt(1000))); user.setCreateTime(new Date()); userMapper.insertUser(user); //发送激活邮件 Context context = new Context(); context.setVariable("email",user.getEmail()); String url = domain + contextPath + "/activation/" + user.getId() + "/" + user.getActivationCode(); context.setVariable("url",url); String content = templateEngine.process("/mail/activation",context); mailClient.sendMail(user.getEmail(),"activate your account",content); return map;} Controller层会在/register路径时接收浏览器的POST请求, 主要是检查调用Service层的方法有没有返回错误信息, 没有则跳转到登录页面, 有则显示错误, 跳转到首页. 123456789101112131415@RequestMapping(path="/register",method=RequestMethod.POST)public String register(Model model, User user){ Map<String, Object> map = userService.register(user); if(map == null || map.isEmpty()){ model.addAttribute("msg","register success, we have sent you an email, please activate your account soon."); model.addAttribute("target","/index"); return "/site/operate-result"; } else{ model.addAttribute("UsernameMessage",map.get("NameMsg")); model.addAttribute("EmailMessage",map.get("EmailMsg")); model.addAttribute("PasswordMessage",map.get("PasswordMsg")); return "/site/register"; }} 激活功能激活无非是把数据库表中对应的status从0改成1.有三种情况: 已经是1了, 已经激活, 不用重复激活. 正常激活. 本来是0, 改成1. 激活码错误. Service层识别这三种情况. 一个小技巧是他用了一个接口, 枚举了这三种情况分别为0,1,2. 如果激活成功记得调用Mapper层的update, 更新一下数据库. 如果重复或者失败要返回错误信息. 1234567891011public int activate(int userId, String code){ User user = userMapper.selectById(userId); if(user.getStatus() == 1){ return ACTIVATION_REPEATED; }else if(user.getActivationCode().equals(code)){ userMapper.updateStatus(userId,1); return ACTIVATION_SUCCESS; }else{ return ACTIVATION_FAILED; }} 其实你在邮箱中点击了链接也就相当于访问了localhost服务器. 服务器的Controller层接收到请求, 其实只需要检查因为这个是路径参数, 检查路径参数的activation code是否正确, 正确则跳转到登录页面, 否则跳转到首页. 12345678910111213141516@RequestMapping(path = "/activation/{userId}/{code}", method = RequestMethod.GET)public String activation(Model model, @PathVariable("userId") int userId, @PathVariable("code") String code){ int result = userService.activate(userId,code); if(result == CommunityConstant.ACTIVATION_SUCCESS){ model.addAttribute("msg","Activate success!!"); model.addAttribute("target","/login"); }else if(result == CommunityConstant.ACTIVATION_REPEATED){ model.addAttribute("msg","您已经激活过了,激活是重复的"); model.addAttribute("target","/index"); }else{ model.addAttribute("msg","激活失败,激活码不正确"); model.addAttribute("target","/index"); } return "/site/operate-result";} 在黑马的前后端分离开发的项目中, Controller层的返回是一个自定义的实体类Result, 其中包含了 状态码, 消息 和 json类型的数据.这个牛客论坛项目并不是一个前后端分离开发的项目, 它通过Thymeleaf模板引擎把.html模板都存在后端服务器上了. md5加密HTTP协议基本性质 简单的 可扩展的 无状态的,有会话的 HTTP介绍HTTP就是几个单词的简写（Hyper Text Transfer Protocol，HTTP），意思就是超文本传输协议，是一个简单的请求-响应协议，它通常运行在TCP之上。它指定了客户端可能发送给服务器什么样的消息以及得到什么样的响应。 HTTP是应用层协议，同其他应用层协议一样，是为了实现某一类具体应用的协议，并由某一运行在用户空间的应用程序来实现其功能。HTTP是一种协议规范，这种规范记录在文档上，为真正通过HTTP进行通信的HTTP的实现程序。 HTTP发展历程最初版本的HTTP协议并没有版本号，后来它的版本号被定位在 0.9 以区分后来的版本。 0.9：0.9协议就是一个交换信息的无序协议，仅仅限于文字。由于无法进行内容的协商，在双发的握手和协议中，并有规定双发的内容是什么，也就是图片是无法显示和处理的。1.0：由于0.9传输仅限于文字，已经不能满足于快速发展的互联网，于是就有了1.0，1.0对0.9进行了扩展，增强了功能，宗旨就是构建可扩展性。在1.0中，已经有了请求头和状态码。1.1：1.1也被称为标准化协议，现在用的最多，1.1在1.0上进行了改进，比如连接可以复用，引入缓存控制机制，支持相应分块等。2.0：2.0又是对1.1的一些改进，2.0和1.1有些基本的不同，例如：HTTP/2是二进制协议而不是文本协议。不再可读，也不可无障碍的手动创建，改善的优化技术现在可被实施。3.0：3.0目前使用不多，是对http的进一步改进，运行速度更快。 HTTP应用场景HTTP是一种协议，也就是一种规则，应用于应用层，基于TCP协议。 HTTP工作原理 客户与服务器建立连接； 客户向服务器提出请求； 服务器接受请求，并根据请求返回相应的文件作为应答； 客户与服务器关闭连接。 cookie参考博客: http://t.csdnimg.cn/salKc Cookie是什么 cookie的中文翻译是曲奇，小甜饼的意思。cookie其实就是一些数据信息，类型为“小型文本文件”，存储于电脑上的文本文件中。 Cookie有什么用 我们想象一个场景，当我们打开一个网站时，如果这个网站我们曾经登录过，那么当我们再次打开网站时，发现就不需要再次登录了，而是直接进入了首页。例如bilibili，csdn等网站。 cookie保存在浏览器中,http协议本身是无记忆的, cookie可以支持一些需要记住状态的场景, 最常见的就是登录. Cookie的表示 一般情况下，cookie是以键值对进行表示的(key-value)，例如name=jack，这个就表示cookie的名字是name，cookie携带的值是jack。 Cookie的组成以下是cookie中常用属性的解释。 Name：这个是cookie的名字 Value：这个是cooke的值 Path：这个定义了Web站点上可以访问该Cookie的目录 Expires：这个值表示cookie的过期时间，也就是有效值，cookie在这个值之前都有效。 Size：这个表示cookie的大小 Cookie的HTTP传输我们还是通过抓包进行查看。首先查看cookie在HTTP请求中是怎样进行表示的。 HTTP请求 我们在发送HTTP请求时，发现浏览器将我们的cookie都进行了携带(注意：游览器只会携带在当前请求的url中包含了该cookie中path值的cookie)，并且是以key：value的形式进行表示的。多个cookie用；进行隔开。 我们再来查看cookie在HTTP响应中是如何进行表示的。 HTTP响应 我在服务器设置了2个cookie，返回给游览器。通过抓包，我们发现在HTTP响应中， cookie的表示形式是，Set-Cookie：cookie的名字，cookie的值。如果有多个cookie，那么在HTTP响应中就使用多个Set-Cookie进行表示。 Cookie的生命周期cookie有2种存储方式，一种是会话性，一种是持久性。 会话性：如果cookie为会话性，那么cookie仅会保存在客户端的内存中，当我们关闭客服端时cookie也就失效了 持久性：如果cookie为持久性，那么cookie会保存在用户的硬盘中，直至生存期结束或者用户主动将其销毁。cookie我们是可以进行设置的，我们可以人为设置cookie的有效时间，什么时候创建，什么时候销毁。 Cookie使用的常见方法 new Cookie(String name, String value)：创建一个Cookie对象，必须传入cookie的名字和cookie的值 getValue()：得到cookie保存的值 getName()：获取cookie的名字 setMaxAge(int expiry)：设置cookie的有效期，默认为-1。这个如果设置负数，表示客服端关闭，cookie就会删除。0表示马上删除。正数表示有效时间，单位是秒。 setPath(String uri)：设置cookie的作用域 HttpServletRequest和HttpServletResponse对Cookie进行操作的常见方法 response.addCookie(Cookie cookie)：将cookie给客户端进行保存 resquest.getCookies()：得到客服端传过来的所有cookie对象 section参考博客: http://t.csdnimg.cn/qVaEd 登录业务 点击登录, 跳转到登录页面 输入用户名, 密码, 验证码 都正确, 则状态改为登录状态, 登录状态除了看帖子, 还可以发帖子. 有错误, 则还是游客状态, 游客状态只能看帖子, 不能发帖 退出登录 实现: 通过生成登录凭证ticket, 存到数据库里, 来解决Http协议没有记忆的问题. 登录凭证有状态信息.数据库: login_ticket表 id user_id ticket status expired 登录凭证: ticket 状态: status 0-正常, 1-过期 expired: 过期时间–现在的网站登录后一段时间就又让你重新登陆, 就是expire指定的 entity 包下写一个LoginTicket类 数据库表 和 java Object相对应, 这种思想应该建立了. Mapper层为什么要有insert?因为登陆成功后要插入将含凭证的一行数据插入到表中, 所以Mapper层首先要有insert方法,insert的返回值一般是int表示影响的行数,参数是java对象longinTicket. 12345@Insert({ "insert into login_ticket(user_id, ticket, status, expired) " + "values(#{userId},#{ticket},#{status},#{expired})"})@Options(useGeneratedKeys = true, keyProperty = "id")int insertTicket(LoginTicket loginTicket); 理解这个login_ticket表中id的含义, 就好理解useGeneratedKeys了.id就是用来唯一标识login_ticket中一行的, 并没有特殊含义.useGenerateKeys就是指定的属性让它自增. 为什么要有select?因为我们后面有一个功能是根据ticket查询用户信息,并现实用户信息.任何网站登陆上去了, 右上角都会显示你的头像,资料之类的.所以我们由ticket查询返回一个LoginTicket对象, 其中的user_id可以唯一确定一名用户, 再去查user表就可以了. 123@Select({"select id,user_id,ticket,status,expired " + "from login_ticket where ticket = #{ticket}"})LoginTicket selectByTicket(String ticket); why update?easy, 登录凭证会过期的. 一般都是返回int, 表示影响的行数, 还记得嘛?参数是LoginTicket对象吗? No. 过期只需要改变status即可, 所以参数是ticket和status. 告诉数据库把那个ticket的状态改成什么status. 123@Update({"update login_ticket set status = #{status} " + "where ticket = #{ticket}"})int updateTicket(String ticket, int status); 这里讲课的老师有个好习惯是写完Mapper就测试一次, 以放出错, 因为有些地方拼写错误不给你报错, 不像java语法, 语法写错了根本运行不了. Service 层要单独开一个LoginService类吗, 无关紧要的事情. 只要把LoginTicketMapper注入进来, 就OK了, 因为本质上就只有Mapper层的三个功能, 插入, 修改, 查询. Login() 到底干了啥?返回值: Map<String,Object> 这个不用太纠结, 因为他这个项目不是前后端分离的.参数: username, password, int expireTime(以秒为单位) 验证空值: 用户名 密码 根据用户名获取到user对象.user.getPassword 与 参数中的password + user.getSalt() 比较md5的唯一性.就其实很神奇的一件事, 因为md5只能加密, 不能解密, 所以其实注册成功之后, 开发者就再也不知道用户密码的明文是什么了, 因为数据库里存的是 (password明文 + salt) 再md5加密后的结果. 登录时的比较也是基于此, 而不是直接比较明文. 至此都没问题的话, 要产生登录凭证. 设置status为0. ticket其实就是generateUUID()随机生成的一段字符串. expire就是 当前时间 + 1000 * 参数中的expireTime(乘1000是转化成毫秒) 1234567891011121314151617181920212223242526272829303132333435363738394041424344public Map<String, Object> login(String username, String password, int expiredSeconds) { Map<String, Object> map = new HashMap<>(); // 空值处理 if (StringUtils.isBlank(username)) { map.put("usernameMsg", "账号不能为空!"); return map; } if (StringUtils.isBlank(password)) { map.put("passwordMsg", "密码不能为空!"); return map; } // 验证账号 User user = userMapper.selectByName(username); if (user == null) { map.put("usernameMsg", "该账号不存在!"); return map; } // 验证状态 if (user.getStatus() == 0) { map.put("usernameMsg", "该账号未激活!"); return map; } // 验证密码 password = CommunityUtil.md5(password + user.getSalt()); if (!user.getPassword().equals(password)) { map.put("passwordMsg", "密码不正确!"); return map; } // 生成登录凭证 LoginTicket loginTicket = new LoginTicket(); loginTicket.setUserId(user.getId()); loginTicket.setTicket(CommunityUtil.generateUUID()); loginTicket.setStatus(0);//0有效, 1无效 loginTicket.setExpired(new Date(System.currentTimeMillis() + expiredSeconds * 1000)); loginTicketMapper.insertTicket(loginTicket); map.put("ticket", loginTicket.getTicket()); return map;} 不管Map的话至此全弄懂了, 结束! Controller层请求方式为啥是POST?首先, 因为路径相同的话, 请求方式也相同就会出错. 我们点击登录, 跳转到登录页面已经有一个/login路径了.同时, 这次是前端页面要向服务器提交用户名, 密码, 验证码, 这种数据放在明文路径后面显然不合适. Controller层的参数怎么写?这就要提到POST请求携带参数的形式了,参考博客:http://t.csdnimg.cn/mmJhM我简单理解, 就是如果不指定,就是key,value形式. 之前做的黑马的前后端分离的项目中, 是用的json格式, 我觉得现代开发大多数还是传的json吧. java controller 层参数: http://t.csdnimg.cn/RlAZm （1）@PathVariable、@RequestParam 、@RequestBody用来获取前台传过来的参数（2）ModelAndView、Model、ModelMap用来返回提示信息给前台界面 <1>例如：操作成功后，返回提示信息：界面显示操作成功！ <2>使用较多的是Model、ModelMap 如何比对验证码?验证码之前我们放到session里了, 现在获取并判断和参数中传入的code是否相等. 如果有误, 则由model携带信息给前端浏览器. 并跳转到登陆界面. 参数具体解释HttpServletResponse 对象用于生成cookie.HttpSession用于获取之前保存在session中的验证码.rememberme 其实就是一个记录的登陆时间长一点儿罢了, 并不是咱们常见的那种记住密码. 如何判断是否登陆成功?controller层为什么还要判断, 是因为这里需要执行相应的跳转, map中有ticket, 说明生成了有效登录凭证, 跳转到首页.没有登录凭证, 说明service层判断出有错误, 那就在model中显示错误, 跳转到登录页面(你重新登陆吧.) 登陆成功:发送cookie给浏览器setPath() 设置cookie的作用范围, 那是只有当 浏览器向服务器通过指定路径发送请求时, 才携带cookie. 12345678910111213141516171819202122232425@RequestMapping(path = "/login", method = RequestMethod.POST) public String login(String username, String password, String code, boolean rememberme, Model model, HttpSession session, HttpServletResponse response) { // 检查验证码 String kaptcha = (String) session.getAttribute("kaptcha"); if (StringUtils.isBlank(kaptcha) || StringUtils.isBlank(code) || !kaptcha.equalsIgnoreCase(code)) { model.addAttribute("codeMsg", "验证码不正确!"); return "/site/login"; } // 检查账号,密码 int expiredSeconds = rememberme ? REMEMBER_EXPIRED_SECONDS : DEFAULT_EXPIRED_SECONDS; Map<String, Object> map = userService.login(username, password, expiredSeconds); if (map.containsKey("ticket")) { Cookie cookie = new Cookie("ticket", map.get("ticket").toString()); cookie.setPath(contextPath); cookie.setMaxAge(expiredSeconds); response.addCookie(cookie); return "redirect:/index"; } else { model.addAttribute("usernameMsg", map.get("usernameMsg")); model.addAttribute("passwordMsg", map.get("passwordMsg")); return "/site/login"; } } 试注册一个账号:machao密码:maxiaochao 成功了! 能看到数据库里多了一行遇到的小bug是, 无论如何都显示密码错误, 看了一下发现是注册的时候加密有问题. 应该是密码 + salt 同时加密. 退出简单了, 我们数据库层面只需要把status置1. 而这个功能我们已经做了. Service层, 我觉得我需要的信息就是, 哪个用户退出了, 所以username或者userId.卧槽, 还真不是, 登录退出主体都是ticket. 直接调用mapper层,改个状态. controller层, 从cookie中获取ticket, 要用到@cookievalue(“ticket”), 用Thymeleaf模板引擎, 就是返回String. 忘记密码 点击忘记密码, 打开忘记密码页面. 在表单中输入邮箱, 点击获取验证码按钮, 服务器向邮箱发送一份验证码 在表单中填写收到的验证码及新密码, 点击重置, 服务器对密码进行修改. Mapper层, 其实就是对password进行update. Service层, 我要知道用户, 新的password, 验证码, 邮箱. Controller层, 我要知道 复盘一下忘记密码功能. 这种没前后端分离的问题是没有接口文档, 这是最恶心的, 其实设计接口才是对业务的理解部分. 总之从页面上看, 有两个路径: 点击获取验证码/getCode, 请求方式是GET 点击修改密码/forget, 请求方式是POST. 至于前端页面是怎么做到点击后就访问这个路径, 其实后端程序员不用关心. 点击获取验证码之后, 要给邮箱发一个邮件, 邮件中包含验证码, 同时验证码要保存在session中, 方便我们后续判断. service层对邮箱做一些判断:是否已经注册, 是否激活等, 并且发送邮件. 发现一点是并不是每个业务功能都需要调用Mapper层. 点击修改密码后, 先比较验证码和session中的是否一致, 一致并且没有过期, 则进service层, 最终修改数据库. 注意这里一个细节是, 对session的判断一般是在controller层进行. 显示登陆信息为什么不能在每个Controller层都检测一遍?很显然请求路径可能特别多, 这样搞耦合度太高, 冗余性太强. 拦截器使用示例 定义拦截器类, 实现HandlerInterceptor接口 配置拦截器, 为它指定拦截,排除的路径 首先,定义拦截器: prehandle(): 在controller前执行 postHandle(): 在controller后执行 afterCompletion(): 在TemplateEngine之后执行 然后, 配置拦截器: excludePathPatterns() 指定的路径不拦截 addPathPatterns() 拦截指定的路径 addInterceptor() 添加拦截器 当拦截器的返回值是布尔类型（boolean）时，这通常表示是否允许被拦截的操作继续执行。true可以放行, false 不能放行. 拦截器总结这张图清楚的展示出如何显示用户的登录信息, 比如头像,用户名等. 主要是通过浏览器给服务器发送的请求中携带的cookie中包含登录凭证ticket, 服务器根据ticket查login_ticket表, 得到user_id, 再查user_id表, 得到user的各种信息. 其中, 获得user对象需要在controller层之前完成, 并且不能将user对象简单的保存在一个java变量中, 因为现实情况是高并发的场景, 所以需要线程隔离, 使用到ThreadLocal, 相当于是每个线程保存自己的user. 这里单独定义了工具类HostHolder. 把ThreadLocal中的user放到modelandView模板中是Controller之后, TemplateEngine之前. 而afterCompletion中, 则需要清除当前的ThreadLocal中的user. 拦截器代码: 定义拦截器123456789101112131415161718192021222324252627282930313233343536@Componentpublic class LoginTicketInterceptor implements HandlerInterceptor { @Autowired private UserService userService; @Autowired private HostHolder hostHolder; @Override public boolean preHandle(HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response, Object handler) throws Exception { String ticket = CookieUtils.getCookieValue(request,"ticket"); if(ticket != null){ LoginTicket loginTicket = userService.getLoginTicket(ticket); if(loginTicket != null && loginTicket.getStatus() == 0 && loginTicket.getExpired().after(new Date())) { User user = userService.findUserById(loginTicket.getUserId()); hostHolder.setUser(user); } } return true; } @Override public void postHandle(HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response, Object handler, ModelAndView modelAndView) throws Exception { User user = hostHolder.getUser(); if(modelAndView != null && user != null){ modelAndView.addObject("loginUser",user); } } @Override public void afterCompletion(HttpServletRequest request, HttpServletResponse response, Object handler, Exception ex) throws Exception { hostHolder.clear(); }} 注册拦截器:1234567891011@Configurationpublic class WebMvcConfig implements WebMvcConfigurer { @Autowired private LoginTicketInterceptor loginTicketInterceptor; @Override public void addInterceptors(InterceptorRegistry registry) { registry.addInterceptor(loginTicketInterceptor) .excludePathPatterns("/**/*.css", "/**/*.js", "/**/*.png", "/**/*.jpg", "/**/*.jpeg"); }} 两个工具类: 从cookie中获得value: 123456789101112131415161718public class CookieUtils { public static String getCookieValue(HttpServletRequest request, String name){ if(request == null || name == null){ throw new IllegalArgumentException("参数为空"); } Cookie[] cookies = request.getCookies(); if(cookies != null){ for(Cookie cookie : cookies){ if(name.equals(cookie.getName())){ return cookie.getValue(); } } } return null; }} HostHolder 1234567891011121314151617@Componentpublic class HostHolder { private ThreadLocal<User> threadLocal = new ThreadLocal<>(); public void setUser(User user){ threadLocal.set(user); } public User getUser(){ return threadLocal.get(); } public void clear(){ threadLocal.remove(); }} 检查登录状态其实叫这个标题有点儿误导性, 他的功能其实就是让你不仅点不到, 也不能通过路径去访问一些你不该访问的页面. 举例子: 你目前没有登陆, 你不该通过/community/user/setting 访问到设置头像的界面. 实现思路拦截器! 自定义一个注解 @LoginRequired 把需要 检查登录状态的 controller 方法都加上该注解 定以拦截器, 检查 controller 方法上是否带有该注解 如果有,则拦截, 并通过response 重定向到登录页面 如果没有, 则放行. 配置拦截器. 总结: 通过自定义注解标记那些需要拦截的方法. 技能点: 自定义注解参考博客:http://t.csdnimg.cn/gOtPm 1、基本介绍☺▶ 什么是元注解： 元注解就是解释注解的注解，它注解的对象是我们前面介绍的注解，如：@Override、@Deprecated 、@SuppressWarnings ▶ 四种元注解： ▷ Retention：指定注解的作用范围，三种 SOURCE,CLASS,RUNTIME ▷ Target：指定注解可以在哪些地方使用 ▷ Documented ：指定该注解是否会在 javadoc 体现 ▷ Inherited：子类会继承父类注解 ▶ 注解的注意事项： ▷ 注解仅存在于源码中，在class字节码文件中不包含 ▷ 默认的保留策略，注解会在class字节码文件中存在，但运行时无法获得， ▷ 注解会在class字节码文件中存在，在运行时可以通过反射获取到 ▷ 首先要明确生命周期长度 SOURCE < CLASS < RUNTIME ，前者能作用的地方后者一定也能作用。 ①：一般如果需要在 运行时去动态获取注解信息，那只能用 RUNTIME 注解； ②：如果要在 编译时进行一些预处理操作，比如生成一些辅助代码（如 ButterKnife），就用 CLASS注解； ③：如果只是做一些 检查性的操作如 @Override 和 @SuppressWarnings，则可选用 SOURCE 注解。 2、Retention注解☺▲ 解释： 只能用于修饰一个 Annotation 定义, 用于指定该 Annotation 可以保留多长时间,@Rentention 包含一个 RetentionPolicy 类型的成员变量, 使用 @Rentention 时必须为该 value 成员变量指定值（值有三种）。 ▲ 三种值： ▷ RetentionPolicy.SOURCE: 编译器使用后，直接丢弃这种策略的注释。 ▷ RetentionPolicy.CLASS: 编译器将把注解记录在 class 文件中 . 当运行 Java 程序时 , JVM 不会保留注解。 这是默认值。 ▷ RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME: 编译器将把注解记录在 class 文件中 . 当运行 Java 程序时 , JVM 会保留注解 . 程序可以 通过反射获取该注解。 3、Target 注解☺▲ 解释： 用于修饰 Annotation 定义，指定被修饰的 Annotation 能用于修饰哪些程序元素。@Target 也包含一个名为 value 的成员变量。 ​​​​​​4、Documented 注解☺▲ 解释： @Documented: 用于指定被该元注解修饰的 Annotation 类将被javadoc 工具提取成文档，即在生成文档时，可以看到该注解。 ▲ 注意： 定义为@Documented 的注解必须设置Retention值为RUNTIME。 5、Inherited 注解☺▲ 解释： 被@Inherited 修饰的注解 将具有继承性，如果某个类使用了被 @Inherited修饰的注解，则其子类将自动具有该注解 修改密码需求分析 在settings 页面, 填写原密码 以及 新密码, 点击保存时, 将数据提交给服务器 服务器收到post请求, 首先根据cookie中的登录凭证查询到当前用户(其实HostHolder里应该封装好了), 然后判断原密码是否输入正确 正确则 update 为新密码, 检查两次密码输入是否一致的功能应该在前端实现. 成功了, 自己写出来了, 还挺开心的. 前端模板中name是干啥的?终于弄明白了: name 要和 Controller 层的参数保持一致, post请求发来参数是key-value形式的,如果参数名 和 name名一致, 就不用加什么注解. 相当于自动就把参数对应上了. 其实涉及到的知识点是下面的注解: 知识点 – @RequestParam参考博客: http://t.csdnimg.cn/c5AUX （1）不加@RequestParam前端的参数名需要和后端控制器的变量名保持一致才能生效 （2）不加@RequestParam参数为非必传，加@RequestParam写法参数为必传。但@RequestParam可以通过@RequestParam(required = false)设置为非必传。 （3）@RequestParam可以通过@RequestParam(“userId”)或者@RequestParam(value = “userId”)指定传入的参数名。（最主要的作用） （4）@RequestParam可以通过@RequestParam(defaultValue = “0”)指定参数默认值 （5）如果接口除了前端调用还有后端RPC调用，则不能省略@RequestParam，否则RPC会找不到参数报错 （6）Get方式请求，参数放在url中时： 不加@RequestParam注解：url可带参数也可不带参数，输入 localhost:8080/list1 以及 localhost:8080/list1?userId=xxx 方法都能执行 加@RequestParam注解：url必须带有参数。也就是说你直接输入localhost:8080/list2 会报错，不会执行方法。只能输入localhost:8080/list2?userId=xxx 才能执行相应的方法 过滤敏感词 算法过程: 三个指针, 指针1指向Tire树根, 指针2 和 指针3 指向字符串 初始指针2和3都在字符串首字符, 3指向的字母 是否在 指针1的下一层出现 若出现, 则说明可能是 敏感词, 指针3 和 指针1 都向下移动 若没出现, 则说明当前字母肯定不是敏感词开头, 指针2 往后移动一个, 指针3 找指针2, 把刚才的字母拼接到result字符串中. 如果检测出敏感词, 则指针2移动到指针3的后一个位置, 指针3找指针2, 指针1复位指向树根. 什么叫符号?CharUtils.isAsciiAlphanumeric(c) 函数检查给定的字符 c 是否是一个属于 ASCII 范围内的字母（A-Z 或 a-z）或数字（0-9）。如果是，该函数通常会返回 true；如果不是，就返回 false。 也就是说, 除了汉字 字母 数字之外的东西都被定义为符号. #$+艹泥–()马 跳过符号这个: #$+艹泥–()马, 最终会输出: #$+*** 也就是说, p1在根节点的时候, 还没有潜在的出现敏感词的可能, 所以p2++, 并把p2刚才指向的字符拼接到sb中.p3每轮都要++, 因为p3每次检测下一个字符. @PostCOnstruct注解容器在实例化Bean之后, 在调用类的构造器之后, 带有该注解的方法会自动执行. 发布帖子AJAX Asynchronous JavaScript and XML 异步javaScript 和 XML, 不是一门新技术, 而是一个新术语 使用AJAX, 网页能将增量更新呈现在页面上, 而不刷新整个页面 X 虽然代表XML, 但是实际上我们都用JSON 示例: controller层代码: 12345678// ajax示例 @RequestMapping(path = "/ajax", method = RequestMethod.POST) @ResponseBody public String testAjax(String name, int age) { System.out.println(name); System.out.println(age); return CommunityUtil.getJSONString(0, "操作成功!"); } 浏览器控制台输出: 发帖子实现要防止发帖时, 标题中带有html标签, 比如我起标题这样起:<script>哈哈<\script>, 浏览器如果把这个标签也解析了,那肯定是不合适的. (有点儿像SQL注入攻击的意思) 遇到bug01insertFields 要少一个id, 因为数据库表主键自增. 小疑惑这里的loginUser我一下子不知道是啥, 凡是前端页面${}里的内容, 都可以猜想是model.addAttribute(“name”,value)add进去的. 果然这里的loginUser就是当时获取登录用户信息时, 拦截器那里add进去的, 有了loginUser, 前端页面才能显示当前用户的状态. 查看帖子详情就是三层架构, 然后我觉得我目前还没有掌握熟悉的还是Thymeleaf模板引擎前端相关的东西, 每次的工作看起来都差不多, 但是具体写什么还是不完全确定. 遇到bug01 这个最后是发现, GET请求接收路径参数, Controller层的参数中要加@PathVariable(“参数名”)这个注解, 忘加了. 事务管理 脏读 幻读 不可重复读 第一类丢失更新 第二类丢失更新 事务隔离级别: 读未提交 读已提交 可重复读 可串行化 锁机制: 悲观锁 共享锁 排它锁 乐观锁 版本号 时间戳 添加评论有个大问题, bug表现: 回复给评论 和 回复给回复显示不出来. 原因是没有理解EntityType.entityType的正确理解是, 回复给指定的类型的该类型在表中的id. 这个id是由前端提交给服务器的.这里设置了entityId, 并返发送给服务器

title: GRE阅读04
content: 短阅读section 122There have long been dead zones—water too low in oxygen to sustain most forms of life—in the Gulf of Mexico, which receives the waters of the Mississippi River. Scientists studied sediment cores from areas where the gulf’s most recent dead zone occurred. The scientists dated the sediment and counted species of foraminifera (marine protozoans) in the sediment; these species thrive in low-oxygen waters. As far back as 1823, the foraminifera thrived especially during Mississippi River flood years (during which nutrients levels increase), suggesting that nutrients in floodwaters can trigger low-oxygen water. The foraminifera in the core samples were most abundant after 1950, when farmers began using some fertilizer, which is rich in nutrients. Researchers believe that increased use of fertilizer leads to more-extreme dead zones. 解析：长期以来，墨西哥湾一直有死亡地带（水的含氧量太低，无法维持大多数生命形式），这里接收密西西比河的水域。科学家研究了海湾最近死亡区发生地区的沉积物岩心。科学家们测量了沉积物的年代，计算了沉积物中有孔虫（海洋原生动物）的种类。这些物种在低氧水域中茁壮成长。早在1823年，有孔虫就在密西西比河洪水期（营养水平增加期间）蓬勃发展，表明洪水中的营养物质可以引发低氧水。1950年后，当农民开始使用富含营养的肥料时，核心样本中的有孔虫最为丰富。研究人员认为，增加化肥的使用会导致更加极端的死区。 Which of the following best describes the function of the highlighted sentence in the context of the passage as a whole? A：It reconciles two opposing theories that were discussed earlier in the passage. B：It suggests what the initial impetus was for the studies mentioned earlier in the passage. C：It undermines a hypothesis that was presented in the preceding sentence. D：It describes a problem with the methodology of the studies discussed in the passage. E：It provides evidence supporting the belief mentioned in the final sentence of the passage. 答案：E解析：句子功能作用题，提问举例的目的。例子在前，观点在后，是倒着总结的，因此选 E。 It can be inferred from the passage that the “researchers” would agree with which of the following statements about the use of fertilizer? A：If farmers near the Mississippi River decreased the amount of fertilizer that they used, the severity of the dead zones could be diminished. B：If farmers near the Mississippi River continue their dependence upon fertilizers, foraminifera population will eventually decline. C：If farmers near the Mississippi River stopped using fertilizers altogether, there would no longer be dead zones. 答案：A解析：可多选题，推理题。定位到：Researchers believe that increased use of fertilizer leads to more extreme dead zones.A：如果减少化肥的使用量， dead zone会减少。正确B错误。继续使用化肥，会加重deadzone 会增强C错误。停止了化肥，会减轻，但是不会消失，毕竟洪水期也会有。 这题简单. 同时每句话读完总结一下的办法好用! section 123Biologist know that some marine algae can create clouds by producing the gas dimethylsulphide (DMS), which reacts with oxygen in air above the sea to form solid particles. These particles provide a surface on which water vapor can condense to form clouds. Lovelock contends that this process is part of global climatic-control system. According to Lovelock, Earth acts like a super organism, with all its biological and physical systems cooperating to keep it healthy. He hypothesized that warmer conditions increase algal activity and DMS output, seeding more clouds, which cool the planet by blocking out the Sun. Then, as the climate cools, algal activity and DMS level decrease and the cycle continues. In response to biologists who question how organisms presumably working for their own selfish ends could have evolved to behave in a way that benefits not only the planet but the organisms as well, cooling benefits the algae, which remain at the ocean surface, because it allows the cooled upper layers of the ocean to sink, and then the circulating water carries nutrients upward from the depths below. Algae may also benefit from nitrogen raining down from clouds they have helped to form. 解析：生物学家知道，一些海藻可以通过产生气体二甲基硫化物（DMS）产生云，DMS与海洋上空的氧气反应形成固体颗粒。这些颗粒提供了一个表面，水蒸气可以凝结在该表面上形成云。L认为这个过程是全球气候控制系统的一部分。根据L的说法，地球就像一个超级有机体，其所有的生物和物理系统都在合作以保持健康。他假设温暖的条件会增加藻类活动和DMS输出，播种更多的云，通过阻挡太阳来冷却地球。然后，随着气候变冷，藻类活动和DMS水平降低，循环继续。为了回应生物学家的质疑（他们质疑有机体为自己的自私目的而工作的方式是如何演变成一种不仅有益于地球而且有益于生物的方式），L指出，冷却有益于留在海洋表面的藻类，因为它允许冷却的海洋上层下沉，然后循环水从下面的深处向上运送养分。藻类也可能受益于从它们帮助形成的云层中下来的氮气。 According to the passage, which of the following occurs as a result of cooling in the upper layers of the ocean? A. The concentration of oxygen in the air above the ocean’s surface decreases. B. The concentration of DMS in the air above the ocean’s surface increases. C. The nutrient supply at the surface of the ocean is replenished. D. Cloud formation increases over the ocean. E. Marine algae make more efficient use of nutrients. replenish v.补充；重新装满 纯考单词题. 认识这个词就不会选E了. 答案：C解析：定位到：Lovelock points out that cooling benefits the algae, which remain at the ocean surface, because it allows the cooled upper layers of the ocean to sink, and then the circulating water carries nutrients upward from the depths below. 这句话是C的同义改写。 Which of the following is most similar to the role played by marine algae in the global climate control system proposed by Lovelock? A. A fan that continually replaces stale air in a room with fresh air from outside. B. A thermostat that automatically controls an air-conditioning system. C. An insulating blanket that retains heat. D. A filter used to purify water. E. A dehumidifier that constantly removes moisture from the air in a room. 答案：B解析：thermostat是自动调温器，与文章内所介绍的藻类通过 DMS 造云来控制cooling process 的循环机制相同。【微信公众号：张巍老师GRE】 The passage mentions the possible benefit to algae of nitrogen falling down in the rain most likely in order to A. provide support for Lovelock’s response to an objection mentioned in the passage B. suggest that the climatic effects of DMS production have been underestimated C. acknowledge that Lovelock’s hypothesis is based in part on speculation D. demonstrate that DMS production alters the planet in more than one way E. assert that algae are the sole beneficiaries of DMS production 答案：A解析：“文章提到雨对algae 的好处是为了什么”定位到最后一句，后面这两句都是为了展示L反驳生物学家质疑说提出的观点。L 的结论是藻类通过 DMS 控制天气，也是地球自我调节过程的一部分。质疑者说藻类当然应该进化出对自己的生存有益的行为。L证明了，藻类的行为不但有利于地球，也有利于自己，这个双赢的逻辑正确。因此答案选A。 Which of the following best describes the organization of the passage? A. A auestion is posed, and several possible answers to the auestion are introduced andevaluated.B. A prediction is made, and certain factors that influenced that prediction are considered.C. A sequence of events is outlined, and a possible cause for the sequence is offered.D. A phenomenon is described, a theory about the significance of the phenomenon is offered, and a reservation about that theory is addressedE. A debate is summarized, the strengths and weaknesses of each position are described, and an assessment of the defensibility of each is made. 答案：D解析：组织结构题。本文开头提出一个现象，随后对这个现象提供了理论解释，同时与解释相关的质疑也得到回应。本题选D。（注意，reservation在此处的含义为doubt） reservation n.怀疑,疑惑 等同于 doubt lt can be inferred from the passage that Lovelock thinks that biologists who question his hypothesis about cyclical DMS output and algal activity make which of the following errors? A. They do not recognize the benefits that Earth receives from the activity.B. They exaggerate the rate at which nitrogen falls from the clouds.C. They assume that the algae remain near the ocean surface throughout the cycle.D. They overlook the benefit that the algae receive from the formation of clouds.E. They fail to recognize changes in surface water temperature that are caused by algae clouds. 答案：D解析：推理题，根据L的观点来选择正确答案。本题的答案，可以由文中，L是如何回应biologists的质疑得到。In response to…, Lovelock points out that cooling benefits the algae,…可知D选项正确，他们忽略了这一点。 The primary purpose of the passage is to A. explain the role played by temperature in the stimulation of DMS production by marine algaeB. outline the sequence of events that occurs during the process of cloud formation caused by algal activityC. describe a dispute about the role played by marine algae in certain instances of cloud formationD. propose a way in which scientists might be able to understand the effects of clouds on marine algaeE. discuss a theory regarding the function of DMS production by marine algae 答案：E解析：本题与第四题考点重合，答案选E。A错。文章的主旨并不是为了解释温度的作用。B错。Outline the sequence不对。这明显是一篇驳论文。有观点，有质疑。C错。前半部分对，后半部分错，他们争议的不是algae在云的形成中扮演的角色。D错。无中生有。 passage 124When Earth formed 4.6 billion years ago, the Sun burned only 70 percent as brightly as it does today. Yet Geologic record contains no evidence for widespread glaciation until 2.3 billionyears ago.Sagan and Mullen suggested in the 1970s that ammonia, a greenhouse gas,warmed early Earth’s atmosphere, but subsequent research showed that the Sun’s ultravioletrays rapidly destroy ammonia in an oxygen-free environment, such as that of early Earth.Many scientists now attribute much of the warming of early Earth to oxygen-intolerantmicrobes—methanogens—that produce the greenhouse gas methane. The methanogenhypothesis could help to explain the first global ice age: 2.3 billion years ago,Earth’satmosphere began to fill with oxygen produced by other microbes-cyanobacteria-causing methanogens to decline rapidly.【微信公众号:张巍老师GRE】1.Which of the following best describes the function of the highlighted sentenceA. It refutes the possibility of a connection between two events previously thought to berelated.B. It describes how a hypothesis might account for the timing of a phenomenon describedearlier in the passageC. lt presents evidence that casts doubt on a statement made in the first sentence of thepassageD. lt clarifies a distinction between two related hypothesesE. It introduces findings that challenge a dominant explanation for a particular phenomenon2.Which of the following can be inferred from the passage about methanogens?A.Methanogens must have appeared on Earth later than 2.3 billion years ago.B.Methanogens must have been much more prevalent in some regions of the early Earth thanin others.C. Methanogens produce a greenhouse gas that is more susceptible to destruction by theSun’s ultraviolent rays than is ammonia.D. Methanogens could not have thrived in early Earth’s atmosphere without the presence ofammonia. ‘E.Methanogens would have had a less significant effect on early Earth’s atmosphere if theyhad evolved after the appearance of cyanobacteria.! 解析：当地球在46亿年前形成时，太阳的燃烧率仅为现在的70％。然而，直到23亿年前，地质记录中没有证据表明存在广泛的冰川作用。S和M在20世纪70年代提出氨，一种温室气体，在温暖早期地球的大气层，但随后的研究表明，太阳的紫外线会在无氧环境中迅速破坏氨，例如早期的地球。现在，许多科学家将早期地球变暖的大部分归因于不耐氧 的微生物 - M - 产生温室气体甲烷。这种假说可以帮助解释第一个全球冰河时代：23亿年前，地球大气开始充满其他微生物产生的氧气 - C - 导致M迅速下降。 答案：B 解析：【微信公众号：张巍老师GRE】 问的是高亮句的作用，作者已经在高亮句中指出，M这一假设可以帮助解释第一个全球冰河时代。因此能看出作者的态度是支持的。因此选B。 答案：E 解析：定位M，找到相关句：Many scientists now attribute much of the warming of early Earth to oxygen-intolerant microbes—methanogens—that produce the greenhouse gas methane. The methanogen hypothesis could help to explain the first global ice age: 2.3 billion years ago, Earth’s atmosphere began to fill with oxygen produced by other microbes—cyanobacteria—causing methanogens to decline rapidly. E的意思是：如果methanogens 比 cyanobateria 出现的晚，作用就不那么重要了。正确，因为后者会杀死前者，前者的暖化作用就被削弱了。 错选了A，看到evolve，看都没看，想当然排除了E这道题再次表明，如果看到一个选项里出现不理解的单词，比如E项的evolve（肯定不是演化，因为完全不符合语境），要马上意识到这道题很可能对。 passage 125Some researchers claim that cetaceans—whales and dolphins—have culture,which the researchers define as the ability to learn from one another.Skeptics, however, demand clear evidence that cetaceans can acquire new behaviors through some form of social learning,preferably clear-cut instances of imitation or teaching.But such evidence is difficult to obtain.While few people doubt that captive cetaceans are adept at imitation or that they reproduce behaviors taught by researchers, biologists seeking insight into cetaceans’ behavior in their natural habitats must rely on deduction rather than experiments. lf members of a particular group share behaviors that do not result from genetic inheritance or environmental variation, then they have almost certainly learned them by watching, following, or listening to other animals. 解析：一些研究人员声称鲸类（鲸鱼和海豚）具有文化，研究人员将其定义为相互学习的能力。然而，怀疑论者要求明确的证据表明，鲸目动物可以通过某种形式的社会学习获得新的行为，最好是明确的模仿或教学实例。但是很难获得这样的证据。虽然很少有人怀疑圈养鲸类擅长模仿，或者他们重现了研究人员教授的行为，但生物学家寻求洞察鲸类动物在其自然栖息地中的行为必须依赖于演绎而不是实验。如果特定群体的成员分享不是由遗传继承或环境变异引起的行为，那么他们几乎肯定通过观察，跟踪或听取其他动物来学习它们。 我第二句理解有误, demand 就是要求, 是怀疑者要求 明确的证据.- captive adj.被圈养的- adept adj.内行的；熟练的；擅长的- deduction n.推论 1.Which of the following best describe the function of the highlighted sentence A. It identifies a factor that complicates biologists’ability to draw conclusions about the behavior of cetaceans in their natural environments.B. lt illustrates the kind of deduction mentioned in the preceding sentence.C. lt explains why skeptics have remained unpersuaded by evidence that has been put forward in support of the claim that cetaceans have culture.D. lt introduces a claim that would be dismissed by both supporters and opponents of the view that cetaceans have culture.E. lt notes a previously overlooked factor that might shed light on the question of whether cetaceans have culture. 答案：B解析：高亮句为最后一句，它的功能就是为了举例说明前一句话中提到的 deduction 。A错。Complicates biologists’ ability 无中生有。C错。解释为何怀疑者remain unpersuaded无中生有。D错。没有introduce a claim.E错。Previously overlooked factor 无中生有。 2.The passage suggests which of the following about captive cetaceans? A. Whether they are engaged in social learning is a subject of disagreement among biologists.B.Their ability to imitate new behaviors is more extensive than that of noncaptive cetaceans.C.They exhibit few behaviors that have not also been observed in cetaceans in their natural habitats.D.They appear to adopt new behaviors more quickly than noncaptive cetaceansE.They exhibit tendencies that suggest a capacity for the kind of behavior that qualifies as cultural. lf members of a particular group share behaviors that do not result from genetic inheritance or environmental variation, then they have almost certainly learned them by watching, following, or listening to other animals. 关键在于文末的这句话, 这句话没有说是哪个生物学家的观点, 或者哪个研究的观点, 那么就是 作者的观点, 说明作者认为 海豚 能 学习, 也就意味着 有 文化. 选E解析：最后作者认可，确实They exhibit tendencies that suggest a capacity for the kind of behavior that qualifies as cultural.A错。文中已经认可，他们有social learning，这个并不是a subject of disagreement.B错。比较级的无中生有。C错。比较级的无中生有。D错。比较级的无中生有。 passage 126Hotter and more massive than the Sun, stars called “stragglers”are puzzling to astronomers because such rapidly burning stars would not be expected to persist in ancient star clusters.Some researchers believe that the typical blue stragglers formed when two ancient,lower-mass stars collide and merge form more massive, hotter star. Peter Leonard theorizes alternatively that in low density globular clusters,where mergers between single stars occur too infrequently to account for the observed quantity of blue stragglers, these stragglers are created instead by a group of stars.He suggests that a pair of stars already orbiting each other presents a larger target for a third star or another pair.Once this new grouping forms, close encounters between the stars could prompt any two to merge as a blue straggler. Leonard’s model predicts that each blue straggler has a distant orbiting companion-as appears true of many blue stragglers in the M67 cluster of the Milky Way galaxy. 解析：比太阳更热，更大，被称为“stragglers”的恒星对天文学家来说是令人费解的，因为这些快速燃烧的恒星按理说不会在古代星团中持续存在。一些研究人员认为，当两颗古老的低质量恒星碰撞并合并形成更大质量，更热的恒星时，形成了典型的Blue stragglers。PL却认为，在低密度球状星团中，单星之间的合并很少发生，以解释观察到的Blue stragglers的数量。这些Blue stragglers应该是由一组恒星创建的。他认为，已经相互绕行的一对恒星为第三颗恒星或另一颗恒星提供了更大的目标。一旦这个新的分组形成，星星之间的近距离接触可能会促使任何两个合并为Blue straggler。PL模型预测每个Blue straggler都有一个遥远的轨道同伴，正如银河系M67星团中的许多Blue stragglers所展示的那样。 1.The reference to a”larger target”serves primarily to suggest why a A. blue straggler would be more likely to collide and merge with another star than would be a lower-mass star.B. pair of stars would be more likely to encounter other stars than would the typical blue straggler.C. pair of stars would be more likely to interact with other stars than would a single star.D.blue straggler would be more likely to interact with a pair of stars than it would with a third star.E. third star would be more likely to encounter a pair than it would to encounter a blue straggler. 答案：C解析：信息目的题——考察讨论对象等细节。直接通过larger target 定位，看到该定位句，He suggests that a pair of stars already orbiting each other presents a larger target for a third star or another pair. 本句的讨论对象为：a pair of stars，而larger target是想说明，a pair of stars更容易与第三颗或另一对星星发生反应。C选项正确。【微信公众号：张巍老师GRE】ABDE，可以直接根据讨论对象不符合而排除，因为这四个选项都提到了blue straggler，虽然这是全文的讨论对象，但是就本句而言，a pair of stars才是该句要解释的对象。 Information presented in the passage suggests which of the following about blue stragglers? A.They originate from stars that are hotter and more massive than the Sun.B.They are burning more rapidly than other types of stars observed in ancient star clusters.C.They are older than most other types of stars within the same star cluster.D.They are less numerous in low-density globular clusters than are pairs of stars.E.They generally originate from the oldest stars among those found in ancient star clusters. 答案：B解析：推断题。本题的第一反应是用blue stragglers来进行定位，但是随后发现，全文都是blue stragglers，所以，应该转变解题思路，从选项入手，利用选项来定位，并判定该选项是否正确。A错。文中说的是stragglers are hotter and more massive than the Sun；而选项说的是组成blue stragglers 的stars are hotter and more massive than the Sun。比较对象错误。B选项正确，定位到第一句：Hotter and more massive than the Sun, stars called “stragglers” are puzzling to astronomers because such rapidly burning stars would not be expected to persist in ancient star clusters. 也就是说，stragglers的特征是rapidly burning；而这一特征原本是不应该出现在ancient star clusters的。也就是说，blue stragglers 比其他恒星燃烧的更快。C错。blue stragglers are older than … 文中找不到对应的依据D错。定位到第三句，blue straggler与pairs of stars的数量对比，在文中无依据。E错。originate the oldest stars 无依据。 3.The passage cites which of the following as evidence undermining the theory presented in the second sentence? A. a discrepancy between the number of mergers between single stars in certain low-density globular clusters and that in other low-density globular clustersB. a discrepancy between the heat and mass of blue stragglers formed by one type of process and the heat and mass of blue stragglers formed by another type of processC. a discrepancy between the frequency of star mergers in low-density globular clusters and those in high-density globular clustersD.a discrepancy between the amount of heat and mass of ancient single stars and that of blue stragglersE.a discrepancy between the number of mergers between single stars in certain star clusters and the number of blue stragglers in those clusters discrepancy n.差异 定位: Peter Leonard theorizes alternatively that in low density globular clusters,where mergers between single stars occur too infrequently to account for the observed quantity of blue stragglers quantity n.数量这句话的意思是: 两个 单独的星球的 合并 太少发生, 不足以解释目前已经观察到的 蓝色星体的 数量我之前理解错的, quantity <–> quality n.质量 3, 答案：E解析：相当于逻辑单题中的削弱题。一定要注意题干中提到的The passage cites which of the following as evidence… 说明，文中有提到证据来削弱第二句的观点。由文章结构，可知这是第三句的内容，alternatively 体现出对比关系。Peter Leonard指出，mergers between single stars太少，而不足以解释the observed quantity of blue stragglers。由此，E选项正确。其余选项都不是文中提到的evidence。 passage 127Most seismologists assume that following a major earthquake and its aftershocks, the fault (abreak in Earth’s crust where pressure can trigger an earthquake) will remain quiet untilstresses have time to rebuild, typically over hundreds or thousands of years.Recent evidenceof subtle interactions between earthquakes may overturn this assumption, however. Accordingto the stress-triggering hypothesis, faults are unexpectedly responsive to subtle stresses theyacquire as neighboring faults shift.Rather than simply dissipating, stress relieved during anearthquake travels along the fault, concentrating in sites nearby; even the smallest additionalstresses may then trigger another quake along the fault or on a nearby fault. Althoughscientists have long viewed such subtle interactions as nonexistent, the hypothesis hasexplained the location and frequency of earthquakes following several destructive quakes inCalifornia, Japan, and Turkey. quite adv.相当,非常 quiet adj.安静的 1.According to the passage,which of the following is an assumption that may be invalidated by recent seismological evidence? A. Earthquakes are caused by stresses building up in faults within Earth’s crust.B.Most major earthquakes can be predicted with reasonable accuracy.C.Faults are highly responsive to even minor stresses in neighboring faults.D.Most major earthquakes are followed by predictable aftershocks.E.A fault that has resulted in a major earthquake becomes quiet for a long period For the following question, consider each of the choices separately and select all that apply. 2.The passage suggests that most seismologists believe which of the following about fault stresses? A.They are dissipated when they result in an earthquake.B. They are transferred between neighboring faults.C.They will not cause a major earthquake along the same fault in the space of a few years. 解析：大多数地震学家认为，在发生大地震及其余震之后，断层（地壳的压力可以引发地震的断裂）将保持平静，直到压力有时间重建，通常是数百年或数千年。但是，最近的证据（地震之间有微妙的相互作用）可能会推翻这一假设。根据压力触发假设，当相邻断层发生变化时，断层会意外地对他们获得的细微压力十分敏感。在地震中沿着断层传播的压力不仅仅是消散，而是集中在附近的地方。即使最小的附加压力也可能沿着断层或附近的断层引发另一次地震。尽管科学家们长期以来认为这种微妙的相互作用并不存在，但这一假设已经解释了加利福尼亚州，日本和土耳其几次破坏性地震后地震的位置和频率。 1.选 E 解析：定位recent seismological evidence. 定位句：Recent evidence of subtle interactions between earthquakes may overturn this assumption, however. 后面是关于这个新证据的详细解释。多数地震学家提出观点，然而最近发现的一些，地震之间存在细微互动的证据，可能推翻这种假设。E选项是大多数地震学家的关系，这点被recent evidence 给invalidated了。 A错。这点不是recent evidence反驳的对象。 B错。无中生有。 C错。这点不是大多数地震学家的观点，而是recent evidence支持的。 D错。无中生有。 可多选题　答案：AC 解析：问的是Most seismologists的观点，定位到第一句。他们认为断层经过一次地震后，要安静一段时间，等积蓄了足够力量才会再次爆发。 B 选项因为是作者支持的假设，因此不选。 passage 128还没做 passage 129做了, 明天整理.

title: 复盘收获and浅浅流水账一下
content: 复盘收获阅读其实挺有意思的. 一句一句的分析, 其实短阅读也就是5句左右. 下次做阅读拿一个草稿纸. 单词不是关键问题, 但是一些常识性的单词确实影响理解, 比如Venus金星. 饭局董哥请吃饭了, 董哥虽然对于我们没啥帮助, 但是说实话, 人家真是对我们还不错, 甭管是不是真心的, 钱是花了, 好吃的是吃了. 财政早饭 0 + 午饭 12 + 晚饭 0咸鱼卖电子书真的是个不错的选择. 不太占用精力 and 可以细水长流. 日常体育排球, 下午背单词, 现在一天背3回, 下午打球, 在北邮确实打得比较顺, 然后晚上吃饭, 复盘昨天的模拟考试. 今天总归是没有做新的题目. 明天又比较忙. 但是争取挤出时间来, 背单词, 做阅读吧. 明天一上午课,好好学, 有时间抽空背单词, 下午没事 先做阅读, 晚上上大数据好好学, 完事儿直接回宿舍. 背单词要是用好缝隙时间, 就真的牛逼了.

title: GRE模考01
content: 昨天模考了一次verbal, 149, 还差不少, 这里复盘一些我觉得还算正常的题目. 填空1Trilobites,with their famously distinctive lobed body plans and curious appurtenances, are____fossils,the perfect symbols of an archaic world. A. archetypalB. elusiveC. obscureD. prevalentE. transitory 选A, 我选对了, 就是因为后面的symbol 让我觉得应该对应 archetypal. appurtenance n.附属物 2The scientist’s disagreement with the mainstream scientific predictions about climate change is (i) _________. Unlike global-warming skeptics, however, he believes that the consensus view actually (ii)_________the problem. sharptechnicalresolvable downplayscapturesoverstates 第一空选sharp（与主流观点很不同）；however取反，与其他人不同，他认为主流观点抓住了问题的所在。 【这位科学家与主流科学对气候变化的预测大相径庭。然而，与全球变暖怀疑论者不同，他认为共识观点实际上抓住了问题所在。】 这题就纯考逻辑, 这逻辑也够逆天的, 把unlike的那半句话去掉, 说得通, 前面说这位科学家强烈反对主流观点, however转折, 后面说科学家认为在某一个问题上, 主流观点抓住了问题所在. 3Nowadays, the conventions held by United States political parties to nominate presidential candidates are little more than carefully orchestrated coronation ceremonies leading to preordained outcomes, but there was a time when nominating conventions were truly_______. A. suspensefulB. contentiousC. statelyD. dignifiedE. combativeF. momentous nominate v.提名 orchestrate v.精心安排 coronation n.加冕礼 preordained adj.注定的 little more than 仅仅是 这个表示逻辑关系的词组是我做错的关键, little其实表示否定含义了, 只多一点儿, 其实就是: 仅仅是 dignify v.使有尊严,使崇高v stately adj.庄严的,宏大的 4Elizabethan actor Richard Tarlton was so____in appearance that a mere glimpse of his grinning face peeping through a curtain was enough to trigger prolonged peals of laughter. A. animated adj.生机勃勃的,活跃的B. risible adj.可笑的C. comely adj.标致的;秀丽的D. Ludicrous adj.荒唐的,滑稽的,可笑的E. handsomeF. anomalous 逻辑较简单, 推出空格处应填入 可笑的 含义. 选择BD. 5Since the data we have analyzed are so __________ , it would be hazardous to draw a definite conclusion. A. copiousB. overwhelmingC. meagerD. paltryE. abundantF. uncertain 选CD. 都表示 少的,微小的,不足的 6The philosopher was a strong advocate of _____: he taught that happiness comes from forgoing one’s desires. A. magnanimityB. dutyC. abstinenceD. pragmatismE. tolerance abstinent adj.节制的；禁欲的 magnanimous 宽宏的，大度的（尤指对敌人或对手） 选择 C. 如果认识C, 明显不会选择E. 同时注意 forgo是 放弃 7Behavior dubbed reprehensible by the residents of the region is considered conventional, even ______ by those of the neighboring region; fortunately, people traveling between the two are resigned to this disparity. A. eccentricB. compulsoryC. innovativeD. unconscionableE. transparent resign v.顺从,辞职 disparity n.明显差异 reprehensible adj.应受谴责的 compulsory adj.强制的,义务的 eccentric adj.古怪的 unconscionable adj.违背良心的 8cholarly works on detective stories often begin with (i)__suggesting that there is something vaguely wrong with adults who spend their time reading such fiction and certainly something (i) ___those who devote energy to its analysis. chronologiesapologiessynopses awry Inastute aboutcourageous about awry adj.斜, 歪; 出错,出岔子 synopsis n.大纲，提要 9Early natural history collections in eighteenth-century Europe were ______ a bear’s tooth might sit incongruously alongside a piece of silver work or, in the menagerie, a South American capybara might be housed next to an African baboon. A. painstakingly arrangedB. impressively comprehensiveC. meticulously organizedD. highly exoticE. fundamentally miscellaneousF. thoroughly eclectic 选择EF. painstaking adj.需用心的,需专注的 meticulous adj.细心的,一丝不苟的 miscellaneous adj.混杂的；各种各样的 eclectic adj.兼收并蓄的 10Despite the rather _____ conditions required for its preservation, the evidence for glaciation during the late Proterozoic is found on every continent, suggesting that ice sheets were present throughout the globe. A. unusualB. hostileC. drasticD. stringentE. exactingF. complex 选DE. 我选对了. stringent adj.严格的 ice sheet n.冰盖 阅读1Findings in biological anthropology suggest that Native Americans’ ancestors probably came to the Americas from northeastern Asia. Turner, for example, has studied the dentition of prehistoric and living Native Americans and northeastern Asians. Based on approximately twenty dental traits, including tooth-crown shape and number of roots, he has defined an overall dental pattern called Sinodonty, which includes three-rooted lower first molars and shovel-shaped incisors. This distinctive pattern is shared among most Native Americans and people from northeastern Asia, but is not found in people who originated in southern Asia, Africa, or Europe. Another less complex pattern — Sundadonty —is shared among the people of southeastern Asia and is also found in prehistoric American populations, but Turner believes that widespread Sinodonty demonstrates most Native Americans’ northeastern Asian origins. 第一句: 美国祖先可能来自亚洲东北. 人类生物学家观点.第二句: 一个人T, 研究了 史前 和 现在 美国本土人 以及 亚洲东北部人的 牙齿.第三句: 基于20个牙齿的特点, 包括…, 他定义出一种叫: Sinodonty 的模式, 该模式….第四句: 这个特殊的模式, 美国本土人 和 亚洲东北人都有, 但是起源于亚洲南部, 非洲或欧洲的人没有.第五句: 另一个没那么明显的模式 Sundadonty 亚洲东南人和史前的美国人都有, 但是T认为 Sinodonty证明 美国本土人和亚洲东北人 是 一个 起源. (1)The passage implies that Turner`s conclusion regarding the origins of most Native American populations is based in part on which of the following findings? 基于一下那个findings, T得出了他的结论? Consider each of the choices separately and select all that apply. A. The presence of Sundadonty among prehistoric American populations A的描述本身是对的, 但是A并不是T这个人得出结论的发现, 因为Sundadonty这玩意亚洲东南人也有. B. The prevalence of shovel-shaped incisors among Native AmericansC. The absence of Sinodonty among people from southern Asia, Africa, and Europe. 选择BC. (2)According to the passage, Sinodonty and Sundadonty differ from one another in that Sinodonty Consider each of the choices separately and select all that apply. A. has been found among prehistoric Native American populations, while Sundadonty has not. A是错的, 文中最后一句. B. is a more complex dental pattern than Sundadonty is B正确 C. occurs frequently in modern Native American populations, while Sundadonty does not. 确实是, 只不过这个要特别细心 + 大胆. 文章里说了Su的这个史前美国有(其实没说现在的美国人有没有), Si的这个史前和现在美国人都有. 2Canali, lava channels on Venus thousands of kilometers long (compared to Earth’s sinuous rilles of a few hundred kilometers) and 1 to 2 kilometers wide, have perplexed scientists. One interpretation of canali origins is that ordinary basaltic silicate lava formed them. Silicate lava is quite erosive initially but rapidly cools and solidifies. Calculations indicate that Venus’ dense atmosphere would accelerate convective cooling, preventing these lavas from flowing thousands of kilometers if erupted in channel-eroding quantities. Alternatively, the volume of lava needed to flow the required distance would have buried the channels we now observe. Therefore, silicate lavas probably cannot form canali. In another interpretation, canali-forming lavas had low viscosity, therefore high mobility, and temperatures closer to their Venusian surroundings, thereby decreasing convective cooling. No silicate lavas possess this combination, but rare carbonatite lavas exhibit both properties: melting points around 500 degrees Celsius and viscosities like water’s. Such lava on Venus would harden slowly,allowing sediments to sink and channels to erode laterally. 第一句: Canli 是 金星上 岩浆通道 上千公里长 1 - 2公里宽, 相比于地球的 几百千米的弯曲的 通道. 让科学家们困惑. sinuous 弯曲的,蜿蜒的 Venus 金星 第二句: 关于 Canali 起源的解释之一 是 一种 obs 的 lava 形成了它们.第三句: 这种lava 刚开始很具有 侵蚀性 但 很快就冷却并且凝固.第四句: 计算表明 金星 浓密的大气层 会 加速冷却, 阻止这些 lava流淌上千千米,第五句: 或者说, 如果喷发的量特别大足以流淌上千公里, 大量的lava可能会把我们当前观测到的通道掩埋起来. alternatively adj.引出第二种选择或可能的建议:要不,或者 第六句: 所以, 这种s lava或许不能形成canali.第七句: 另一种解释是: 形成canali的岩浆 黏性很低, 流动性很强, 并且温度接近于金星表面, 因此可以减缓冷却. viscosity n.黏性 mobility n.流动能力, 活动性 第八句: s lava不 同时具有这些属性, 但是 rc lava展示出全部这些属性: 熔点在500度左右 + 黏性就像水.最后一句: 这种lava可以在金星上缓慢的变硬, 这就使得 沉淀物沉积, 并且进一步侵蚀形成隧道. sediment 沉淀物, 沉积物 (1)The passage is primarily concerned with discussing which of the following? A.Recent theories about how Venusian atmospheric conditions affected the formation of the planetB.Comparisons of the temperatures and viscosities of different lava typeC.Possible explanations for the origins of a certain characteristic of the Venusian landscapeD.Possible resolutions to the debate on the differences between surface characteristics of certain planetsE.Alternative model of for the effect of lava on the different kinds of Venusian surfaces C. 分析完文章之后很容易. (2)According to the passage, which of the following best describes Earth’s lava channels? A.Fairly deep but similar in width to canaliB.Fairly deep and confined to relatively small areasC.Wide and separated by low ridges of basaltic silicate lavaD.Winding and shorter than canaliE.Wavy and deeper than canali 选D. 要求认识sinuous. (3)Which of the following best describes the attitude of the author of the passage toward the first theory described in the passage? A.Qualified acceptanceB.Unequivocal rejectionC.Reasoned dismissalD.Earnest perplexityE.Tentative assent 选择了C. B选项毫不犹豫地拒绝还是有点儿问题, 因为毕竟说了一个 probably. dismissal n.不予考虑 3In the United States, studying the territoriality of nonnative ants such as the red fire ant, a species native to South America, may-seem unlikely to yield generalizable results-but it does have distinct advantages. Most importantly, whereas the fire ant shares habitat with many ant competitors in South America, its communities in the United States are much simpler. Colonizable landscape is blanketed almost continuously with fire ant territories. so all territorial boundaries are with other fire ant colonies. We can study the complexities of territoriality in almost pure, continuous populations of a single species, without the complicating influences of other competitors. Furthermore, the high densities of many fire ant populations ensure that interactions among competing colonies will be intense and obvious. 对一种 非美国本土的 原产自南美的 红火蚂蚁 的研究, 看起来很难产生通用性的结果, 但是确实又独特的优势. whereas 然而, 但是. 最重要的是, 尽管红火蚂蚁 在南美 与很多竞争者共享栖息地., 它们在南美的社区简单得多. 全部被 红火蚁 的领地覆盖, 所以所有的边界 都是和其他 火蚁 的领地. 我们可以研究一个物种的连续的领地, 而不受其他竞争者的影响. 不仅如此, 火蚁的 高密度 确保了 竞争领地之间的交流将会是 紧密而明显的. colony n.殖民地 territory n.领土 blanket n.毛毯 v.覆盖 (1)The primary function of the highlighted sentence is to A. provide evidence that helps explain the success of the red fire ant in the United StatesB. identify a feature of red fire ant colonies in the United States that makes them appealing to researchersC. suggest why red fire ant colonies have been so damaging in many regions of the United StalesD. explain why researchers feel that studying the territoriality of red fire ants in the United States may yield problematic resultsE. suggest a reason for the absence of competitors to the red fire ant in the United States B. (2)The author implies that red fire ants in the United States differ from red fire ants in South America in the extent to which ants in the two environments A. dominate their habitatB. interact with other red fire ant coloniesC. have had their territorial behavior studied by researchers AB.

title: 新学期第一天and模考
content: gre模考就感觉其实模考也就是练个节奏, 熟悉一下考试模式, 题目做起来, 包括解析, 感觉都很奇怪, 有些地方明明是一个单词, 单词中间却有空格. 有些题目的解析特别牵强. 模考verbal还是只有149, 仍然有20%的关键单词不认识. 6 选 2有好转.我认为下一步应该把重心放在阅读上. 开销早饭13 + 午饭 12 + 晚饭 15 + 水果 6 = 46 课内决定把linux退了下一代Internet 老师很牛, 讲课很垃移动应用, 认真上, 管他有没有用, 跟着课内学. plan今晚上: 看看把模考的题能总结的总结一下, 单词再看一会儿. 明天:阅读, 长阅读开始做. 逻辑单题也练练.单词: 抖词的单词每天复习60个一点儿不多.List 4 实实在在搞熟练.

title: 移动应用开发class01
content: 内容 概述 基础通信网络 终端 Android 开发 ios 开发 要求 平时作业,手机编程作业 大作业: 设计实习一个移动互联网的应用,题目不限 CH_1 概述移动互联网的定义三要素: 网络: GPRS, 3G, 4G(全ip化), 5G, (RFID, WiFi,卫星)等移动通信网络实现终端接入互联网 终端: 手机, 笔记本, 快递站的扫码设备… 服务: 社交, 支付, 搜索, 游戏… 移动互联网的演进 移动增值网: 增值业务 独立wap网站: 网站独立于运营商, 直接面向消费者. WAP网关. 移动互联网 宽带无线互联网 可以让服务端以为你的手机是一个PC机, 而不是一个手机. UA : user agent APN : APN指一种网络接入技术，是通过手机上网时必须配置的一个参数，它决定了手机通过哪种接入方式来访问网络. access point name. 移动互联网特点 便携 + 位置化手机是怎么定位的?基站:随时随地广播信息.三角定位:多个基站,可以确定某个终端的位置. 共享单车定位?GPRS或者通过单车连接手机定位手机 即时性 + 永远在线 交互性 二维码, 音视频, 重力感应, NFC…手机的NFC的卡模式 or 全模式: 充当NFC的读卡器 and 标签. 还是只能充当标签. 时间碎片化 终端能耗 移动互联网与互联网的关系签名: 通过加密和解密完成的. U盾. 物联网愿景: 高级军用车辆 – 智能轮胎压力控制器. 移动互联网的体系架构云: 业务与应用管道: 接入, 地址分配, 漫游终端: 硬件, 操作系统, 应用软件 ip要保证在很大一个范围内不能变, 比如整个北京城区. 作业 APN 查看手机IP地址, 使用流量和wifi, IP的归属地是那里. 用手机和电脑分别访问: wap.qq.com wap.baidu.com 等手机网站, 有啥不同. 两个手机之间传输信息, 必须联网吗? 蓝牙. 二维码.wifi两种模式 : dcf 和 pcf

title: GRE填空12
content: 单空题section 971.Even months after massive storm, there remained a heavy, suspended sediment load in the surface water overlying the coral reef, the___ water a testament to the storm’s effects.A. turbidB. stagnantC. fathomlessD. turbulentE. brackish sediment n.沉淀物 coral n.珊瑚 reef n.礁 testament n.证明,证据 turbid adj.浑浊的,混乱的 stagnant adj.停滞的;水因为停滞而污浊的 fathom v.理解,弄清真相 fathomless adj.不能理解的,深不可测的 turbulent adj.动荡的,湍急的 brackish adj.salty in an unpleasant way 解析：水中的沉淀能够证明水是浑浊的，所以答案选A选项。turbid浑浊的。 翻译：就算是在大风暴之后的好几个月，依然有重的悬浮在水表面的沉淀物位于珊瑚上，浑浊的水证明了风暴的影响。 2.Later in the book, the author takes pains to____ the claims she had made earlier, as though she recognizes their implausibility and wants to quell skepticism by narrowing their scope.A. qualifyB. applyC. reiterateD. verifyE. jettison qualify v.修饰,限定 pain n.痛苦 as though 好像 解析：空格对应narrowing their scope，所以正确答案选A选项。qualify 限制，修改。 翻译：在他书的后面部分，作者费尽心思地去限制修改他在前面部分所作出的言论，好像她意识到它们（前面部分）的不可信而且想要去通过缩小范围来平息怀疑。 section 961.The anthropologist____the claim that the Neanderthal remains must represent an immediate family because they belong to the same mitochondrial lineage, noting that some chimpanzees with identical mitochondrial are not closely related.A. misappliedB. queriedC. expandedD. substantiatedE. surmised chimpanzee n.黑猩猩 mitochondrial adj.线粒体的 lineage n.血统 immediate adj.直系的 surmise v.猜测,推测 substantiate v.证明,证实 misapply v.误用,滥用 解析：后面人类学家说了有相同线粒体的大猩猩没有紧密的联系，说明他对前面的那个说法是持怀疑态度的，所以答案选B选项。query质疑。 翻译：这个人类学家质疑了这样一个说法：N残余物一定代表着一个直系的家族,因为这些残余物属于相同的线粒体家族。该人类学家还提到一些有着相同线粒体的大猩猩也不是紧密相关的。 我这个题目错了的原因在 noting that 没有辨认出来: 注意到的意思 While the current coffee craze was sparked by the emergence of flavorful, high-quality gourmet varieties, a slew of studies suggesting that concerns about coffee’s health effects may be____ has nurtured the trend.A. underemphasizedB. exacerbatedC. unfoundedD. documentedE. recapitulated v.重述；概括 slew n.大量,许多 考句子划分: concerns (about coffee’s health effects) may be ___. 空格处是修饰concerns的. 解析：让步转折关系，通过前面说的尽管对于咖啡有狂热，但是说咖啡健康担忧的说法没有根据的这些研究也能帮助咖啡狂热的趋势，所以正确答案选C选项。unfounded无根据的。 翻译：尽管当前对于咖啡的狂热是被可口的高质量的精美的各种菜肴而激发起来，但是大量表明关于咖啡的健康效果的担忧可能是无根据的研究也培养了这种趋势（就是咖啡的狂热）。 section 95Some minor misgivings about the book notwithstanding, the editor’s claim that the work will be recognized as “the authoritative history of sports for this era” is thoroughly____A.absurdB.undemonstratedC.credibleD.outlandishE.researched notwithstanding 虽然；尽管 解析：根据notwithstanding推知空格和misgivings取反，所以正确答案选C选项。credible可信的。 翻译：尽管对于这本书有一些小的担忧，但是这个编辑说的这个作品会被当成“这个时代运动的权威历史”的言论是完全可信的。 in the 1630s, directors of the Dutch West india Company received reports of minor problems from their agents with___,as the company was wealthy enough not to be overly concerned about small frustrations.A. trepidation n.恐惧,不安(害怕不好的事情发生)B. consternation n.惊愕,惊恐(得知不好的事情发生)C. gratitude n.感激D. equanimity n.平静,镇定E. exhilaration exhilarate v.使高兴,使兴奋 解析：后文说公司有钱不用担心小的挫折，所以说明公司的董事在面对这些关于错误的报告时是一种镇定的态度，答案选D选项。equanimity镇定。 翻译：在17世纪30年代，Dutch West India Company的董事们用一种镇定的态度去接收一些来自于代理机构的关于小错误的报告，因为这个公司足够的富有以至于不用过分担心小的挫折。 section 941.For the ancient Egyptians, inequality in human society was not___nature; in other words,existing differences—between rich and poor, strong and weak-were not viewed as a necessary part of the natural order of things.A. superseded byB. detectable inC. ameliorated byD. inherent inE. excluded from supersede v.取代,代替 解析：后文说这个东西不是必须的成分，所以同义重复前面应该就是“不是内在的属性”，所以正确答案选D选项。inherent内在的。 翻译：对于古代埃及人来说，在人类社会的不平等并不是内在的特质。换句话说，现存的差异（在穷人和富人间，强者和弱者间的差异）并没有被看成是事物自然秩序的必要成分。 It was quite __ for Sir Isaac Newton to believe in alchemy—most of the experimental scientists of his era did.A. unethicalB. braveC. pretentious adj.炫耀的,装B的,自命不凡的D. reasonableE. controversial 解析：既然那个时代大部分科学家都信炼金术，说明牛顿的做法也是合情合理的，所以正确答案选D选项。reasonable合理的。 翻译：牛顿相信炼金术是很合理的—在那个时代大部分实验科学家都相信炼金术 6 选 2section 327.In ways large and small, millions of people are taking active steps to___the medical mainstream, whether by taking herbal remedies for disease or by placing their hope for a cure in alternative treatment.A.augmentB.sidestepC.supportD.vilify v.诽谤,中伤E.circumvent v.回避,避开F.endorse 选错了, 我错选了CF. 但是注意到alternative, 也就是人们都寻求可替代的其他方式. 那么很显然, 选择 BE. 都是 回避,避开的意思, 更合理. 解析：by taking herbal remedies和by placing their hopes for a cure in alternative treatment都能体现这些人避开了主流的医学，所以正确答案选BE选项。sidestep回避，circumvent避开。 翻译：以或大或小的方式，很多人正在积极地采取措施避开医学主流，或者通过采用草药治疗疾病，也或者通过用其他的治疗方式来取代他们的希望。 8.Although its gray text blocks and black-and-white illustrations give it a sober mien, this one-stop resource can take the place of a dozen less___ texts.A. exhaustiveB. interestingC. appealingD. originalE. educationalF. comprehensive 选AF. 选对了. 解析：此题关键点是one-stop，“一站式的”体现的是“全面”的意思，所以这里是在拿全面的东西和less全面的东西进行比较，所以空格选one-stop的同义词，正确答案选AF选项。exhaustive全面的，comprehensive全面的。 翻译：尽管它的灰色的文本和黑白的插图给了它一种严肃的感觉，这种一站式的资源却能够取代不全面的文本。 9.The media have constantly disparaged the governor’s competence and have found a public only too eager to applaud their____.A. assiduousnessB. stupefactionC. mockeryD. incredulityE. certitudeF. derision disparage v.蔑视,轻视 competence n.能力 assiduous adj.勤奋的 certitude n.确定 incredulous adj.怀疑的 解析：their指代的是前面的媒体，所以空格同义重复媒体的态度disparage，所以正确答案选CF选项，mockery嘲笑，derision嘲笑。注意too…to…结构在表示心情的时候不取反，比如too willing to do something应该理解为太乐意去做某事。 翻译：媒体长期鄙视政府的能力而且发现公众很急切地去赞扬他们（媒体）的嘲笑。 10.The__of ophthalmology as a field in the United States from 1820 to 1850 is evident in the opening of at least five eye hospitals during this period, offering new venues for ophthalmictreatment and experimentation.A. sophisticationB. retrenchmentC. burgeoningD. resurgenceE. curtailmentF. expansion ophthalmic adj.眼科的,眼睛的 evident adj.清楚的,显然的 venue n.地点 选CF. 我选对了, 但是完全是根据两个意思相近的词选择的. curtail v.限制,缩短 sophisticated adj.复杂的,见多识广的 解析：后面说offering new venues for ophthalmic treatment and experimentation，说明这种眼科在这个时间段是发展迅速的，所以正确答案选CF选项。burgeoning激增，expansion扩张。 翻译：在1820年到1850年美国眼科学的扩张是很明显的，在这段时间至少五家眼科医院开张了，能够提供眼科治疗和实验的新场所。 section 337.Aerial viewings of the gigantic stone horse attributed to the Native American Quechuan people fail to__the considerable artistry required to create the piece: the horse appears crudely constructed unless carefully examined from the ground. A. revealB. justifyC. manifestD. mitigateE. diminishF. undercut aerial adj.从飞机上的,空中的 crudely adv.粗糙地 manifest v.表明 解析：语义推理，后文说马如果不好好检验的话就会粗制滥造，说明这些空中观察无法揭示重要的艺术才能，答案选AC选项。reveal揭露，manifest展现。 我当时选错了. 翻译：由美洲盖比亚人建造的巨石马，在空中俯瞰的时候，没有能够显示出建造一个艺术品的时候应该有的艺术性。这匹马看起来是被极其粗糙的建造，除非是在地面上仔仔细细地观察。 8.The book aims to illuminate how science has changed the meaning of nothingness from___ philosophical concept to something we can almost put under a microscope.A.a tangibleB.a palpableC.a nebulousD.a nettlesomeE.an incontrovertibleF.a vague nebulous adj.模糊的 nettle n.荨麻 v.惹恼,使...生气 palpable adj.易察觉的,明显的 incontrovertible adj.无可争辩的,不容置疑的} > 解析：from...to...说明空格处选to后面something we can almost put under a microscope的反义，所以正确答案选CF选项。nebulous模糊的，vague模糊的。 > 翻译：这本书想要阐释科学是如何已经改变了空洞的含义，从模糊的哲学概念变成了一些我们能够在微观世界下看到的东西。 9.Few ideas are more____ than the notion that cultures evolve in Darwin fashion; many academics have begun writing about cultural evolution, but few treat the underlyingDarwinian logic with the care it deserves. A. abused B. archaic C. misused D. outdated E. divisive {% psw adj.引起分歧的；制造分裂的F. derivative n.衍生物 adj.非原创的 解析：few treat the underlying Darwinian logic with the care it deserves说明这个达尔文的理念本来是好的，但是大家不重视，所以这里的few ideas也是一样的，所以正确答案选AC选项。abused错误使用，misused误用的。 翻译：一些关于达尔文进化论的想法比观念更加滥用，很多学院开始写关于文化进化论的论文，但只有一些对达尔文观点潜在的逻辑给予了它应得的重视。 6 选 2 选两个意思一样的确实是一种办法. 10.The initial,widely shared pessimism turned out to be__, because it ignored the many things that could be done with resources left behind.A. unintelligible impossible to understand难以理解的；难懂B. unfathomable adj. 深不可测的C. unfoundedD. unimaginativeE. unjustified 不公正的,不正当的F. unimportant 解析：because it ignored the many things说明之前的这种悲观是没有根据的，所以正确答案选CE选项。unfounded无根据的，unjustified不合理的。 翻译：原本被广泛分享的厌世情绪被发现是未被证明正确的。因为它忽略了很多可以用背后的资源完成的事情。 section 347.Historically, the depletion of soil’s nitrogen has been one of the most___problems faced by farmers: an essential nutrient, nitrogen is quickly leached from soil, and farmers have struggled to find ways to replenish it.A. capriciousB. ubiquitousC. worrisomeD. stubbornE. intractableF. unpredictable depletion –> deplete v.大量减少；耗尽 nitrogen n.氮 replenish v. 补充，重新装满；补足（原有的量） intractable adj. very difficult to deal with 难对付的,棘手的 解析：struggled to find ways to replenish it说明这个问题比较严重，正确答案选DE选项。stubborn顽强的，intractable倔强的。 翻译：从历史观点上来讲，土壤中氮养分的消耗是一个农民们面临的最为顽固的问题之一，作为一个特别重要的养分，氮迅速被土壤过滤，农民们尝试了好多好多办法去补充氮元素。 8.Scientists should hope the faults in their theories will be___ their peers since the refutation of one hypothesis can free its originator to develop a better one.A. discerned byB. disregarded byC. discovered byD. ignored byE. opaque toF. inspiring to 解析：refutation of one hypothesis和空格同义重复，所以空格体现refutation，那就是错误被发现，正确答案选AC选项。discern觉察，discover发现。 翻译：科学家们应该寄希望于他们理论中的问题能够被他们的同事发现，因为反驳一个假设能够释放它原来的发明者去形成一个更好的假设。 9.Although men still dominate the ranks of full professors in the field of astronomy,the increasing numbers of younger women in the field could___a change in its gender mix.A. requireB. alleviateC. blockD. presageE. portendF. hinder 解析：【微信公众号：张巍老师】女性加入这个领域必然预示着性别混合会有改变，正确答案选DE选项。presage预示，portend预示。 翻译：尽管男人仍然占有航天科学领域中大部分教授的主导位置，在这个领域中年轻的女性的数量也在逐渐上升，这预示着这个行业中男女比例的一个变化。 10.An apparent paradox led the scientists to pursue their present line of research.They were struck by the fact that a single mathematics formula can be used to describe physical phenomena that appear to be so____.A. rudimentaryB. interdependentC. interrelatedD. complexE. heterogeneousF. dissimilar 解析：他们struck by（被震惊）因为一个数学公式就能描述各种各样的物理现象，空格选single反义词，正确答案选EF选项。heterogeneous各种各样的，dissimilar不同的。 翻译：一个显然的悖论导致科学家们继续他们现在的研究，他们震惊于这样一个事实，即一个单一的数学公式能够被用来描述如此有差异的物理现象。

title: GRE阅读03
content: passage 215W.E.B. Du Bois’ exhibit of African American history and culture at the 1900 Paris Exposition Universelle attracted the attention of a world of sociological scholarship whose value his work challenged. Du Bois believed that Spencerian sociologists failed in their attempts to gain greater understanding of human deeds because their work examined not deeds but theories and because they gathered data not to affect social progress but merely to theorize. in his exhibit. Du Bois sought to present cultural artifacts that would shift the focus of sociology from the construction of vast generalizations to the observation of particular, living individual elements of society and the working contributions of individual people to a vast functioning social structure. The passage implies that Du Bois attributed which of the following beliefs to Spencerian sociologists? A. Theorizing is important to the understanding of human actionsB.Vast generalizations have limited value.C.Data gathering is a relatively unimportant part of sociological researchD.Sociology should focus on the living elements of society rather than cultural artifacts.E.Particulars are more important than universals. A解析：推断题。根据Du Bois和Spencerian sociologists可以定位到原文第二句。本题实质上是考察长难句分析。their (Spencerian sociologists) work examined not deeds but theories and they (Spencerian sociologists) gathered data not to affect social progress but merely to theorize。可知，Spencerian sociologists认为theorizing更重要，综上，A选项正确。B选项错，vast generalization非答案区间。C选项错，relatively unimportant 比较关系的无中生有D选项错，cultural artifacts 非答案区间E选项错，无中生有。 我这个题做错是因为没读懂题目, 题目是问Spencerian sociologist怎么样, 我理解成了Du Bois怎么样.题目翻译: 这段话暗示了杜波依斯将以下哪一种信仰归因于斯宾塞社会学家?
